SPACE1889.ActiveDefenseDesc: Active defense = Dexterity (or another primary attribute in combination with the corresponding talent, like Calculated defense)
SPACE1889.ActiveDefenseVehicleDesc: The Active Defense is the value in the Vehicle skill, i.e. Driving or Special Vehicles (Vehicle Type). If no pilot can control the vehicle in the turn, Active Defense is omitted, and only Passive Defense counts (without any modifiers). A mount has either its Dexterity or its rider's Riding skill value as Active Defense.
SPACE1889.PassiveDefenseDesc:
Passive defense = constitution + armor
(For vehicles only the pAbw).
SPACE1889.Name: Name
SPACE1889.OrOperator: use or insted of and for the two preconditions
SPACE1889.TotalDefenseDesc: In dire circumstances, your character may focus entirely on her defense – blocking blows, parrying strikes, and dodging ranged attacks all at the same time. By giving up her attack action, your character gains a +4 bonus to her Defense rating until her next turn.
SPACE1889.LightLoadDesc: Your character moves and performs actions without penalty.
SPACE1889.MediumLoadDesc: Your character is encumbered and suffers a -1 penalty to his Dexterity and Move ratings.
SPACE1889.HavyLoadDesc: Your character is heavily encumbered and suffers a -2 penalty to his Dexterity and Move ratings.
SPACE1889.MaxLoadDesc: Your character can attempt to carry up to double his Heavy Load weight, but he suffers a -4 penalty to his Dexterity and Move ratings. If this reduces his Move rating to 0 or less, he can pick up the load, but not carry it. Each turn your character carries a maximum load he must exert himself.
SPACE1889.MaxLoadConsequence: Dex-2; Move-2; 1N Damage per h resp. combat round
SPACE1889.ImpossibleLoadConsequence: The character cannot bear the weight!
SPACE1889.VehicleIsPureMusclePowerInfo: Vehicle is moved by pure muscle power alone
SPACE1889.VehicleCaptainDesc: A commanding officer commands with diplomacy (leadership) or intimidation (orders).
SPACE1889.VehiclePilotDesc: A pilot, helmsman or rider must be present in every vehicle - a cyclist is also a pilot. He controls the vehicle with Pilot (vehicle type) or Drive, or his mount with Ride.
SPACE1889.VehicleCopilotDesc: A co-pilot, trimmer, co-driver, or other helper to the pilot operates a second control, such as the elevators, or assists in driving - often by contributing a teamwork bonus of +2 dice to a vehicle probe. However, the co-pilot can also take over the rehearsal himself, for example when an airship is to climb.
SPACE1889.VehicleGunnerDesc: A (main) Gunner leads a gun crew and rolls attack rolls on Gunnery + damage of the weapon(s).
SPACE1889.VehicleSignalerAndLookoutDesc: A signalman communicates with enemy and allied vehicle crews by means of flags or beacons. He or she should be proficient in linguistics (codes) and preferably have good perception. A signalman is also an excellent lookout.
SPACE1889.VehicleSignalerDesc: A signalman communicates with enemy and allied vehicle crews by means of flags or beacons. He or she should be proficient in linguistics (codes).
SPACE1889.VehicleLookoutDesc:
In the second function, the signalman may assist the gunner in teamwork as a lookout.
Prerequisite: Perception >= 4
SPACE1889.VehicleMechanicDesc: A mechanic takes care of the technology on board and rolls samples for Craft skills, especially mechanic.
SPACE1889.VehicleMedicDesc: A medic can be any player character with the Medicine skill who is not needed for other actions. He or she can provide first aid during and after combat (see EE page 153).
SPACE1889.VehicleNoGunner: Firing the ship's weapons without a gunner is not possible.
SPACE1889.VehicleNoCompendiumActor: This does not work like that! The actor must first be imported into the world before he can be added as a crew member.
SPACE1889.VehicleInfoSwivelMountPos: Weapon is swivel mounted ({spot}) on/in the vehicle and has a swiveling range of {swivelingRange} deg.
SPACE1889.VehicleInfoRigidlyMountPos: Weapon is rigidly mounted on/in the vehicle ({spot}) and must be aligned via the vehicle.
SPACE1889.VehicleInfoNotMounted: Weapon is in the storage space of the vehicle and therefore cannot be used.
SPACE1889.VehicleApproachDistanceDesc:
Ausgangssituation: Der Pilot ist als Angreifer an der Reihe.
Voraussetzung: Fahrzeug – oder ein Reittier, das nicht selbst ein Manöver durchführt.
Kosten: Verzicht auf alle Abwehraktionen (nur Passive Abwehr) oder 2 Manöverpunkte.
Probe: Keine, aber eine Fahrzeug-Probe (+/– Teamwork und Manövrierfähigkeit sowie optional Umgebungsmodifikator und Raumnachteil) erhöht die zurückgelegte Entfernung pro zwei Erfolgen um Tempo x1 Meter.
Auswirkung: Der Pilot manövriert das Fahrzeug diese Runde nicht bloß in eine bessere Position im Raum, sondern beschleunigt, um eine Strecke zurückzulegen und damit die Entfernung zu einem Gegner zu verkürzen/vergrößern. Ohne Probe sind das Tempo x5 Meter für Fahrzeuge, Bewegung x 1,50 Meter für Reittiere. Das Manöver ist also das Kampf-Pendant der Verfolgung aus dem Abschnitt Fortbewegung zu Land, zu Wasser und in der Luft.
Variante Steigen/Sinken: Bewegt sich das Fahrzeug oder Tier in drei Dimensionen, dann kann die Besatzung das Manöver zum Steigen oder Sinken nutzen (also sich mehr vertikal als horizontal bewegen). Auf einem Flug- oder Luftschiff würfelt hierfür der Kopilot (Trimmer) die Probe, während der Pilot assistiert. Ein Flieger, der steigt und eine größere Flughöhe als der Gegner erreichen kann, beziehungsweise ein Unterwasserfahrzeug / eine Unterwasserkreatur, das auf größere Tiefen ausgelegt ist, darf endgültig die Flucht ergreifen, wenn es mit dem Manöver die Maximalreichweite aller gegnerischen Waffen verlässt.
SPACE1889.VehicleUtmostPowerDesc:
Ausgangssituation: Der Pilot ist als Angreifer an der Reihe.
Voraussetzung: Fahrzeug – oder ein Reittier, das nicht selbst ein Manöver durchführt.
Kosten: Verzicht auf alle Angriffs- und Abwehraktionen (nur Passive Abwehr; Nachladen bleibt davon unberührt) oder 4 Manöverpunkte.
Probe: Keine, aber eine Fahrzeug-Probe (+/– Teamwork und Manövrierfähigkeit sowie optional Umgebungsmodifikator und Raumnachteil) erhöht die zurückgelegte Entfernung pro Erfolg um Tempo x1 Meter.
Auswirkung: Der Pilot manövriert das Fahrzeug diese Runde nicht bloß in eine bessere Position im Raum, sondern beschleunigt – mit Hilfe der Mannschaft am Antrieb (Maschinen, Segel, Ruder) – um mit einem Kraftakt eine große Strecke zurückzulegen und damit die Entfernung zu einem Gegner erheblich zu verkürzen/vergrößern. Ohne Probe sind das Tempo x10 Meter für Fahrzeuge, Bewegung x3 Meter für Reittiere. Wie bei Annähern/Entfernen ist eine Variante Steigen/Sinken möglich.
SPACE1889.VehicleTurnaroundDesc:
Ausgangssituation: Der Pilot ist als Angreifer an der Reihe.
Voraussetzung: Fahrzeug – oder ein Reittier, das nicht selbst ein Manöver durchführt.
Kosten: Verzicht auf alle Abwehraktionen (nur Passive Abwehr) oder 2 Manöverpunkte.
Probe: Fahrzeug-Probe (+/– Teamwork und Manövrierfähigkeit sowie optional Umgebungsmodifikator und Raumnachteil), Erfolgsschwelle 2
Auswirkung: Der Pilot bringt das Fahrzeug in eine deutlich bessere Lage. Er oder sie erhält in der nächsten Runde die erzielten Erfolge als Bonuswürfel für die Initiative-Probe. Ergibt die Fahrzeug-Probe allerdings weniger als zwei Erfolge, dann sind von der nächsten Initiative-Probe 4 Würfel abzuziehen. Der Pilot hat das Fahrzeug geradewegs in eine Schusslinie gewendet.
SPACE1889.VehicleAbruptBrakingAccelerati:
Ausgangssituation: Der Pilot ist als Angreifer an der Reihe.
Voraussetzung: Fahrzeug – oder ein Reittier, das nicht selbst ein Manöver durchführt.
Kosten: Verzicht auf alle Angriffsaktionen (Nachladen bleibt davon unberührt) oder 3 Manöverpunkte.
Probe: Fahrzeug-Probe (+/– Teamwork und Manövrierfähigkeit sowie optional Umgebungsmodifikator und Raumnachteil), Erfolgsschwelle 2
Auswirkung: Die Mannschaft am Antrieb (Maschinen, Segel, Ruder) ändert während der Runde überraschend die Geschwindigkeit, sodass der Pilot eine unerwartete Fahrtänderung vollführen kann. Er oder sie erhält für die nächste Abwehrprobe (diese oder nächste Runde) die erzielten Erfolge +4 als Bonuswürfel, allerdings auch 4 Würfel Abzug von der nächsten Initiative-Probe. Im Fall von weniger als zwei Erfolgen bei der Fahrzeug-Probe gibt es keine Bonuswürfel auf die nächste Abwehr und sogar 8 Würfel Abzug auf die nächste Initiative. Der Pilot hat die Geschwindigkeitsänderung nicht auffangen können. Stattdessen gerät beispielsweise das Fahrzeug in Schieflage, oder das Reittier stolpert, weil es zwar gehorcht, aber der Reiter nicht angemessen reagiert.
SPACE1889.VehicleRammingDesc:
Ausgangssituation: Der Pilot hat die Entfernung zum gegnerischen Fahrzeug auf weniger als eigenes Tempo x1 Meter reduziert und ist als Angreifer an der Reihe.
Voraussetzung: Fahrzeug, kein Reittier
Kosten: Verzicht auf alle nachfolgenden Aktionen (nur Passive Abwehr) diese Runde oder 4 Manöverpunkte.
Probe: Fahrzeug-Probe (+/– Teamwork und Manövrierfähigkeit sowie optional Umgebungsmodifikator und Raumnachteil) als Angriffswurf gegen eine Abwehrprobe des verteidigenden Fahrzeugs.
Auswirkung: Erzielt der Angriff mehr Erfolge, beschleunigt der Angreifer und rammt den Verteidiger.
● Wenn sich der Verteidiger die Runde nur umpositioniert und nicht mit Annähern/Entfernen eine Strecke zum/vom Angreifer zurücklegt, dann erleiden beide Fahrzeuge als Strukturschaden das Tempo des Angreifers geteilt durch 10 (abgerundet), bei sehr schnellen Fahrzeugen (ab Tempo 50) geteilt durch 5, jeweils abzüglich der gewürfelten Abwehrerfolge.
● Wenn sich der Verteidiger die Runde annähert, dann prallen die Fahrzeuge mit voller Geschwindigkeit frontal aufeinander. Beide erleiden als Schaden die Summe aus beiden Tempo-Werten geteilt durch 10 (abgerundet), bei sehr schnellen Fahrzeugen geteilt durch 5, jeweils abzüglich der Abwehrerfolge.
● Wenn sich der Verteidiger die Runde entfernt, erleiden beide als Schaden nur die Differenz aus beiden Tempo-Werten geteilt durch 10 (abgerundet), bei sehr schnellen Fahrzeugen geteilt durch 5, jeweils abzüglich der Abwehrerfolge.

In jedem Fall erleidet das kleinere Fahrzeug zusätzlich Schaden in Höhe der Größendifferenz, das größere Fahrzeug entsprechend Schaden in Höhe der Größendifferenz weniger. Ein Luftschiff darf dafür nur die halbe Größe werten.
Variante Abdrängen: Nach erfolgreicher Vergleichsprobe wird Tempo / 10 (bzw. 5) – Abwehrerfolge +/– Größendifferenz nicht von den Struktur-Werten abgezogen, sondern ist für den Verteidiger ein Malus auf nachfolgende Fahrzeug-Proben bis einschließlich der nächsten Initiative.
SPACE1889.VehicleTotalAttackDesc:
Initial situation: At least one gun is operational this turn.
Requirement: Vehicle or mount with guns installed on it.
Cost: Waive all defensive actions (Passive Defense only) or number of guns involved in the maneuver divided by 2 (rounded down) + 2 maneuver points (and then no more points for gun use without maneuver).
Roll: Guns (+/- modifiers) for the attack Effect: The crew focuses on offense this turn and gets 2 bonus dice on each attack.
SPACE1889.VehicleDoubleShotDesc:
Ausgangssituation: Ein Geschütz der Feuerrate H oder V ist einsatzbereit und der Kanonier an der Reihe.
Voraussetzung: Fahrzeug oder Reittier mit darauf installierten Geschützen.
Kosten: Verzicht auf alle Abwehraktionen (nur Passive Abwehr) oder Anzahl am Manöver beteiligter Geschütze geteilt durch 2 (abgerundet) + 1 Manöverpunkt
Probe: Geschütze (+/– Modifikatoren) für den Angriff.
Auswirkung: Die Größe jedes beteiligten Geschützes zählt für den Angriff doppelt in die Salvengröße hinein (ohne zusätzliche Beschränkungen durch die Zielgröße, es entsteht durch das Manöver auch kein Flächenangriff). In der Regel sind dies Maschinengewehre, die dann jeweils als Geschütz der Größe 2 statt 1 zählen. Kommt keine Salve zum Einsatz, dann würfelt der Kanonier einfach für jedes am Manöver beteiligte Geschütz statt einem Angriff zwei Angriffe mit jeweils minus 4 Würfeln (dies geht dann auch mit automatischen Geschützen der Größe 0).
SPACE1889.VehicleContinuousFireDesc:
Ausgangssituation: Ein Geschütz der Feuerrate V ist einsatzbereit und der Kanonier an der Reihe.
Voraussetzung: Fahrzeug oder Reittier mit darauf installierten Geschützen.
Kosten: Verzicht auf alle Abwehraktionen (nur Passive Abwehr) oder Anzahl am Manöver beteiligter Geschütze geteilt durch 2 (abgerundet) + 2 Manöverpunkte.
Probe: Geschütze (+/– Modifikatoren) für den Angriff
Auswirkung: Der Schütze feuert einen Strom von Geschossen auf dasselbe Ziel. Die Größe jedes beteiligten Geschützes zählt für den Angriff dreifach in die Salvengröße hinein (ohne zusätzliche Beschränkungen durch die Zielgröße, es entsteht durch das Manöver auch kein Flächenangriff). In der Regel sind dies Maschinengewehre, die dann jeweils als Geschütz der Größe 3 statt 1 zählen. Kommt keine Salve zum Einsatz, dann würfelt der Kanonier einfach für jedes am Manöver beteiligte Geschütz drei Würfel mehr (dies geht dann auch mit vollautomatischen Geschützen der Größe 0).
SPACE1889.VehicleAimedShotDesc:
Ausgangssituation: Ein Geschütz ist diese Runde einsatz- oder eine Einzelperson schussbereit. Das Fahrzeug oder der Schütze ist an der Reihe.
Voraussetzung: Fahrzeug oder Reittier mit darauf installierten Geschützen – oder ein Charakter, der mit einer Schuss- oder primitiven Fernkampfwaffe auf ein Fahrzeug zielt.
Kosten: Verzicht auf alle Abwehraktionen (nur Passive Abwehr) oder Anzahl am Manöver beteiligter Geschütze geteilt durch 2 (abgerundet) + 1 Manöverpunkt.
Probe: Geschütze (+/– Modifikatoren) mit einem zusätzlichen Malus von –2 Würfeln beim Anvisieren von Steuerung, Antrieb oder Geschützen des gegnerischen Fahrzeugs bzw. –4 Würfeln beim Feuern speziell auf die Besatzung.
Auswirkung: Bei Übertreffen der Abwehrprobe des Verteidigers hat der Kanonier nur den halben erwürfelten Strukturschaden (abgerundet) am Fahrzeug als Ganzem angerichtet, der Verteidiger muss aber zusätzliche Abzüge entsprechend der anvisierten „Zone“ hinnehmen.
● Steuerung: Für den Leistungsabfall hinsichtlich Manövrierfähigkeit zählt der bei diesem Treffer erwürfelte Schaden doppelt.
● Antrieb: Für den Leistungsabfall hinsichtlich Tempo zählt der bei diesem Treffer erwürfelte Schaden doppelt.
● Geschütze: Es fallen Geschütze einer Größe in Höhe des erzielten (halben erwürfelten) Schadens (abgerundet) aus (bis sie repariert sind). Beim Spiel mit der Salvengröße wird einfach diese reduziert. Beim Spiel mit Einzelgeschützen wählt die Spielleitung die Waffen aus, die ausscheiden, oder überlässt die Entscheidung den Spielern.
● Besatzung: So viele Personen, wie Schaden erwürfelt wurde, erleiden „Kollateralschäden“. Das ist der halbe (also hier der an der Fahrzeugstruktur erzielte) Schaden, den man mit Passiver Abwehr noch abmildern kann. Der Einfachheit halber können Nichtspielercharaktere einfach für den Rest des Kampfes ausfallen. Die Spielleitung entscheidet, ob Nichtspielercharaktere vor den Spielercharakteren betroffen sind (S. 153).

Auch bei gezielten Treffern von Steuerung, Antrieb und Geschützen können Charaktere – wie bei normalen Treffern – „Kollateralschäden“ erleiden. Diese sollten sich jedoch auf sehr wenige Personen beschränken, die sich tatsächlich an den betreffenden Orten aufhalten. Sie bekommen den halben erwürfelten Schaden ab, reduziert durch einen Wurf auf Passive Abwehr + ggf. Deckung.
SPACE1889.VehicleSignalingDesc:
Ausgangssituation: Während der Aktionen des Angreifers.
Voraussetzung: Signalgeber hat die Hände frei und ist sichtbar.
Kosten: Keine Teilnahme des Signalgebers an anderen Aktionen diese Runde oder 1 Manöverpunkt.
Probe: Linguistik (Codes), Erfolgsschwelle 2, erschwert um den Sichtmodifikator (nur Flaggen; optionale Regel, Seite 148) und Entfernungsmodifikator (Flaggen und Licht; Seite 148).
Auswirkung: Die Nachricht kommt beim Empfänger an. Dieser muss sie ebenfalls mit einer Linguistik-Probe (Erfolgsschwelle 2) entschlüsseln. Der Spieler des Signalgebers kann die Erfolgsschwelle beider Proben absichtlich anheben, wenn er oder sie eine Nachricht an ein befreundetes Fahrzeug nicht bloß in einem Standardcode (Morsen) sendet, sondern sie zusätzlich chiffriert. Sie wird dadurch auch für „mithörende“ Feinde schwieriger zu entschlüsseln, die Erfolgsschwelle ist für sie zusätzlich um 2 erhöht.
SPACE1889.VehicleTemporaryRepairsDesc:
Ausgangssituation: Das Fahrzeug hat Strukturpunkte verloren und ist an der Reihe.
Voraussetzung: Fahrzeug; falls keine Ersatzteile verfügbar: das Talent Mit Draht und Zuversicht (Seite 26)
Kosten: Keine Teilnahme des Mechanikers an anderen Aktionen diese Runde oder 1 Manöverpunkt.
Probe: Handwerk-Fertigkeit (in der Regel Mechaniker), Erfolgsschwelle 2, mit jeder Reparatur während des Gefechts steigt die Schwelle um 1.
Auswirkung: Der Mechaniker dichtet ein Leck ab, ersetzt einen defekten Kolben oder Ähnliches. Damit stellt er oder sie einen verlorenen Punkt Struktur (mit Talent Blitzmechaniker (siehe Seite 21) zwei oder mehr Punkte Struktur) oder einen Punkt Salvengröße des beschädigten Fahrzeugs höchstens für die Dauer des Kampfes wieder her. Alternativ kann der erfolgreiche Mechaniker die Folgen massiver Treffer (siehe Seite 153) oder gezielter Schüsse (siehe Seite 156) auf Steuerung oder Antrieb aufheben. Der Leistungsabfall wird dann wieder normal anhand der insgesamt verlorenen Struktur gezählt. Nach dem Kampf oder aber einer weiteren Beschädigung an Struktur, Salvengröße, Steuerung beziehungsweise Antrieb verfallen die Auswirkungen provisorischer Reparaturen wieder.
SPACE1889.VehicleBoardDesc:
Ausgangssituation: Der Pilot hat die Entfernung zum gegnerischen Fahrzeug auf weniger als eigenes Tempo x1 Meter (bei Einsatz einer Enterharpune zum Heranziehen: Tempo x2 Meter) reduziert und ist als Angreifer an der Reihe. Kommt keine Enterausrüstung (Seile und Haken oder eben eine Enterharpune) zum Einsatz, dann darf die Entfernung nicht größer sein als die Weitsprung-Distanz (GRW S. 156) des Enternden mit der kleinsten Bewegung.
Voraussetzung: Das gegnerische Fahrzeug ist groß genug, um weitere Personen aufzunehmen (also kein Fahrrad oder Kanu).
Kosten: Verzicht auf alle nachfolgenden Aktionen (nur Passive Abwehr) diese Runde oder 4 Manöverpunkte.
Probe: Sportlichkeit für die Enternden (siehe Seite 137 für Fertigkeitswerte der Besatzung). Führt ein Spielercharakter das Enterkommando an, darf er selbst würfeln. Vorhandene Enterausrüstung (Seile und Haken) gibt einen Bonus von 2 Würfeln. Die vergleichende Aktion geht gegen die Sportlichkeit der verteidigenden Besatzung. Investiert diese ebenfalls die Kosten, erhält sie einen Bonus in Höhe des Grundschadens (ohne Nahkampf-Wert) der stärksten „tödlichen“ Nahkampfwaffe. Dies simuliert das Durchtrennen der Enterseile und ähnliche Verteidigungsmaßnahmen. Außerdem erhält die größere Besatzung einen Bonus von +2 – oder sogar +4, wenn sie mehr als doppelt so viele Personen umfasst.
Auswirkung: Der Fahrzeugkampf zwischen beiden Fahrzeugen endet und mündet in einen Kampf Person gegen Person auf dem Deck des geenterten Fahrzeugs. Sind die Verteidiger noch an der Reihe, können sie bereits diese Runde mit Fernkampfwaffen zurückschlagen und damit unter Umständen noch Eindringlinge daran hindern, auf das Deck zu gelangen. Auch ein Gezielter Schuss (Besatzung) kann helfen.
Verwickeln die Angreifer in den folgenden Runden nicht alle Verteidiger in Duelle, weil sie vielleicht etwas anderes an Bord vorhaben (zum Beispiel Plündern), dann können die Verteidiger in den folgenden Runden versuchen, mit Sportlichkeit (ggf. + Bonus für die größere Besatzung) ihr Schiff wieder zu befreien. Die Erfolgsschwelle ist die Anzahl der überzähligen Erfolge der ersten Enterprobe. Hatten die Angreifer dagegen mehr als doppelt so viele Erfolge wie die Verteidiger, ist ein Befreien nicht mehr möglich.
SPACE1889.VehicleBombDesc:
Ausgangssituation: Das Flugschiff ist mit einer Angriffsaktion an der Reihe. Nur verfügbar, wenn der Angreifer sich vorher (letzte oder diese Runde) mit Annähern/Entfernen über dem Gegner positioniert und das Ziel sich seitdem nicht bewegt hat (Aktive Abwehr oder Bewegungsmanöver).
Voraussetzung: Flug- oder Luftschiff, Personen auf fliegenden Tieren oder fliegende Personen, die mit Bomben ausgestattet sind.
Kosten: Verzicht auf alle Abwehraktionen (nur Passive Abwehr) oder 2 Manöverpunkte.
Probe: Sprengstoffe (oder Geschütze) + Schaden des Sprengkörpers als Angriffswurf (mit Modifikatoren wie bei einem Geschütz-Angriff).
Auswirkung: Die Angreifer öffnen im richtigen Moment eine Klappe, lösen einen Haltemechanismus oder werfen die Bombe ab, wodurch sie auf das Ziel darunter fällt und explodiert (Bombe), birst und ihre Splitter verstreut (Splitterbombe) bzw. in Flammen aufgeht (Brandbombe). Ist das Ziel beweglich, darf es aktiv abwehren, sonst nur passiv.
SPACE1889.VehicleDeployRetractExplosiveD:
Ausgangssituation: Das Fahrzeug ist mit einer Angriffsaktion an der Reihe.
Voraussetzung: Flug- oder Luftschiff, das mit einem Schlepptorpedo oder einer Kabelmine bestückt ist.
Kosten: Verzicht auf alle Abwehraktionen (nur Passive Abwehr) oder 2 Manöverpunkte.
Probe: Sprengstoffe + Schaden des Sprengkörpers (ohne Modifikatoren) ergibt den Angriffswurf für den Fall, dass die Falle ausgelöst wird; keine Probe für das Einfahren nötig.
Auswirkung: Der Charakter lässt einen Sprengkörper an einem Kabel vom Schiff herab (Schlepptorpedo) beziehungsweise hinauf (Kabelmine mit Flugholz) – oder holt diesen sicher wieder ein.
Einem Schiff mit ausgesetztem, scharfem Sprengkörper können sich Gegner (oder Verbündete) nur bis auf maximal deren Tempo x1 Meter annähern, sonst laufen sie Gefahr, die Mine auszulösen:
Sie müssen den beim Aussetzen ausgewürfelten Angriff abwehren. Gelingt dies, ohne dass Schaden entsteht, hat der Gegner den Sprengkörper umflogen. Er ist nicht detoniert und weiterhin scharf, dafür hat sich der Gegner erfolgreich angenähert. Das letzte Wort bei der Einschätzung der Position im Raum – wer kommt aus welcher Richtung? – hat die Spielleitung.
SPACE1889.VehicleManoeuvreNotPossible: The {name} vehicle is unable to maneuver and therefore cannot perform the {manoeuvreName} maneuver!
SPACE1889.VehicleIsOverloaded: The {name} vehicle carries too many installed weapons and is overloaded. This has a negative effect on maneuverability.
SPACE1889.VehicleExceedingOverloadMax: The vehicle {name} can not install so many weapons! So firing the weapons is not possible.
SPACE1889.VehicleIsOverloadedInfo: Overload! Overload limit of the cannons is {max} (current value {current}).
SPACE1889.VehicleExceedingOverloadMaxInf: Invalid configuration! Installation limit of the cannons is {max} (current value {current}).
SPACE1889.SkillGroupDescAkaWissen:
Base Attribute: Intelligence

Academics represents general knowledge of the Humanities and Liberal Arts, acquired through formal education or intensive self-study. Your character has spent time studying a particular subject, such as history, philosophy, or religion, and can discuss this topic at length.

Your character must focus on a specific discipline:

  • Anthropology: The science of human beings, makes it possible to quickly find one’s way even in foreign cultures.
  • Economics: knowledge of economic relationships and appropriate government action to manage them.
  • History (Earth): The study of human history from pre-historic to modern times
  • History (Mars): The study of Martian history from pre-historic to modern times
  • Law: The study of law and the understanding of various legal practices
  • Literature: The study of literature, and familiarity with writers and their works
  • Philosophy: The study of logic, thought, and the meaning of life
  • Religion: The study of theology, and familiarity with various religious beliefs
SPACE1889.SkillGroupDescHandwerk:
Base Attribute: Intelligence

Craft represents experience and training in a specific profession or trade. It covers a wide range of technical and craftsman skills, such as carpentry, electronics, and mechanics. Characters with this skill are able to build, repair, or modify items in their chosen craft.

Your character must focus on a specific discipline:

  • Carpentry: The ability to build and repair wooden structures and furniture
  • Crystal technology: The use of Martian crystals, which is still not understood in large parts.
  • Electronics: The ability to build and repair electronic devices
  • Mechanics: The ability to build and repair mechanical devices such as engines
  • Metallurgy: Knowledge of properties and processing of metals and their alloys.
  • Pharmacy: The ability to prepare and create various tonics and medicines
SPACE1889.SkillGroupDescKunst:
Base Attribute: Intelligence

Art represents experience and training in a specific art form. It covers a wide range of artistic disciplines such as painting, sculpting, and writing. Characters with this skill are able to create, design, or critique art within their chosen field.

Your character must focus on a specific discipline:

  • Architecture: Classification of buildings and styles.
  • Music: The ability to write and compose songs and musical scores
  • Painting: The ability to draw, illustrate, and paint images
  • Photography: The ability to take photographs and develop pictures and film
  • Sculpture: The ability to carve and sculpt both busts and statues
  • Writing: The ability to write poetry, novels, and short stories
SPACE1889.SkillGroupDescNaturWissen:
Base Attribute: Intelligence

Science represents your character’s education and training in the physical or life sciences. It covers biology, chemistry, geology, engineering, and physics. It also covers mathematics and experimental methods for these disciplines. Characters with this skill are trained in a specific science and can experiment in their chosen field.

Your character must focus on a specific discipline:

  • Astronomy: Observation and knowledge of celestial bodies.
  • Biology: Knowledge of botany, zoology, and experimental methodology
  • Chemistry: Knowledge of chemical compounds and experimental methodology
  • Engineering: Knowledge of engineering principles and design methodology
  • Geology: Knowledge of minerals and natural resources, and their composition
  • Mathematics: Analysis of abstract structures using logic.
  • Physics: Knowledge of forces, motion, and experimental methodology, including the investigation of the Ether.
SPACE1889.SkillGroupDescSpezFahrzeuge:
Base Attribute: Dexterity

Pilot represents your character’s ability to pilot complex and unusual vehicles. It covers the operation of aircraft, ships, sailboats, and more exotic vehicles such as drilling machines and submarines. Characters with this skill are able to pilot a specific vehicle with skill and expertise.

Your character must focus on a specific discipline:

  • Aeroplanes: The ability to pilot air planes and ornithopters
  • Aircraft: The ability to pilot motor-powered air craft
  • Air ships: The ability to pilot zeppelins and comparable vessels
  • Balloons: The ability to pilot balloons of all shapes and sizes
  • Boats: canoes, rafts and rowing boats of all kinds.
  • Cloud ships: The ability to pilot wind-powered air craft
  • Drilling Machines: The ability to pilot tunneling or drilling machines
  • Ether Flyers
  • Motor ships: The ability to pilot motor-powered ships of all shapes and sizes
  • Sailing Ships: The ability to pilot wind-powered ships of all shapes and sizes
  • Submarines: The ability to pilot a submarine or submersible vessel
  • Tripods: three-legged tanks

SPACE1889.AbilityConDesc: Body represents your character’s constitution and toughness. It determines how much damage your character can take and how resistant he is to injury. It also determines how long he can go without food and water. Characters with high Body ratings are rugged and tough, while characters with low Body ratings are frail and sickly.
SPACE1889.AbilityDexDesc: Dexterity represents your character’s speed, coordination, and agility. It determines your character’s ability to avoid damage, and how quickly he reacts to danger. It is also the basis for a character’s ranged combat, stealth, and piloting skills. Characters with high Dexterity ratings are quick and graceful, while characters with low Dexterity ratings are slow and clumsy.
SPACE1889.AbilityStrDesc: Strength represents your character’s vigor and muscle power. It determines how much damage your character does in close combat, and how much weight she can carry. It is the basis for a character’s close combat and athletic skills. Characters with high Strength ratings are strong and powerful, while characters with low Strength ratings are weak and lethargic.
SPACE1889.AbilityChaDesc: Charisma represents your character’s confidence and personality. It also determines how persuasive and attractive your character is to others. It is the base for interpersonal and performance skills. Characters with high Charisma ratings are charming and magnetic, while characters with low Charisma ratings are rude and unattractive.
SPACE1889.AbilityIntDesc: Intelligence represents your character’s reason and intellect. It determines how well your character senses the world around him and how quickly he reacts to danger. It is the basis for all knowledge and craft skills. Characters with high Intelligence ratings are clever and observant, while characters with low Intelligence ratings are dim-witted and inattentive.
SPACE1889.AbilityWilDesc: Willpower represents your character’s courage and resolve. It determines how hard it is for others to manipulate your character. It also represents your character’s will to live, and determines how much damage he can take in combat. Characters with high Willpower ratings are courageous and determined, while characters with low Willpower ratings are craven and gullible.
SPACE1889.SecondaryAttributeSizDesc:
Size represents your character’s height, weight, and bulk. Unlike other Secondary Attributes, Size is not calculated, it is set at zero for average human characters. Larger and smaller Sizes are generally for children, animals, and non-human characters.
Your character’s Size rating modifies his Defense, Health, and maximum Body and Strength ratings. It is also subtracted from his Stealth and attack rolls. Larger characters are easier to hit, but they are stronger and take more damage to kill. Conversely, smaller characters are harder to hit, but are weaker and take less damage to kill.
SPACE1889.SecondaryAttributeMovDesc:
Move represents how fast your character moves during combat and while walking or running. Your character’s Move rating is calculated as follows:
Move = Strength + Dexterity
Characters with the Athletics Skill can substitute that Skill rating for their Move rating.
Characters with high Move ratings are strong and fast, while characters with low Move ratings are slow and easily tired. A character’s Move rating is used to calculate how fast he can walk, run, swim, climb, and jump. See the chart below to convert Move ratings to distance.
SPACE1889.SecondaryAttributePerDesc:
Perception represents your character’s ability to notice and interpret her surroundings. It also represents her ability to focus her attention and remain vigilant over long periods of time. The more successes you roll, the more observant your character will be. In some cases, your roll will be opposed by another character’s Stealth roll. Failing to roll enough successes means that your character misses something or overlooks a vital piece of information.
Your character’s Perception rating is calculated as follows:
Perception = Intelligence + Willpower
Characters with high Perception ratings are insightful and observant, while characters with low Perception ratings are oblivious and unaware.
SPACE1889.SecondaryAttributeIniDesc:
Initiative represents how quickly your character reacts to danger. It also determines when he acts during a combat round. The more successes you roll for Initiative, the earlier your character acts during combat.
Your character’s Initiative rating is calculated as follows:
Initiative = Dexterity + Intelligence
Characters with high Initiative ratings are quick and vigilant, characters with low Initiative ratings are slow and often surprised.
SPACE1889.SecondaryAttributeDefDesc:
Defense represents your character’s toughness and ability to evade attacks. This includes avoiding an attack and protecting vulnerable areas. An attacker must roll more successes than your character’s Defense rating to hurt her. If the attacker rolls fewer successes, the attack misses, but if he rolls more successes than your Defense rating, your character takes that much damage. See p. 208 and 211 for more detail on Defense and damage.
Your character’s Defense ratings are calculated as follows:
Defense = Passive Defense + Active Defense – Size
Passive Defense = Body rating
Active Defense = Dexterity rating
Characters with a high Defense rating are tough and hard to wound, while characters with low Defense ratings are weak and easily hurt.
Sometimes your character will only get to use her Active Defense rating or her Passive Defense rating. This normally occurs when your character is unable to evade an attack or when her attacker is only trying to touch her. Some bonuses and penalties will only apply to your Active or Passive Defense ratings. Some modifications only account for the Active or the Passive Defense rating.
SPACE1889.SecondaryAttributeStuDesc:
Stun represents your character’s ability to shrug off damage and keep fighting. If your character takes more damage than his Stun rating in a single blow, he is stunned and loses his next action. If your character takes more damage than twice his Stun rating in a single blow, he is knocked out for a number of minutes equal to the amount of excess damage he took.
Your character’s Stun rating is calculated as follows:
Stun = Body rating
Characters with high Stun ratings are resilient and determined fighters, while characters with low Stun ratings are weak and easily dispatched.
SPACE1889.HealthDesc:
Health represents your character’s vitality and capacity to take damage. This covers both Lethal and Nonlethal damage. Your character can take up to her Health rating in damage without suffering any ill effects. When your character’s current Health rating drops below zero, she falls unconscious. When it reaches –5 Health, she dies. See p. 211ff. for more information about healing and damage.
Your character’s Health rating is calculated as follows:
Health = Body + Willpower + Size
Characters with high Health ratings are robust and resistant to wounds; characters with low Health ratings are weak and fragile.
SPACE1889.StyleDesc:
Arguably the most important resource in the game, Style points can be used to give your character a boost, thus allowing him to perform extraordinary feats. With Style points you can buy bonus dice, reduce damage, or boost your character’s talents. They may also be spent to support your character’s friends and allies.
Style points are used to reward players for the kind of roleplaying that makes the game more fun for everyone. The more things you do to benefit the game, the more effective your character will become, and the more fun it will be for all involved.
SPACE1889.XpDesc:
Just like real people, characters learn and grow over time: they hone their skills, develop their talents, and expand their knowledge. Most of what characters learn however, lies beyond the pages of a rulebook. They learn from their failures, but learning not to make mistakes in the first place requires common sense, which cannot be found on a character sheet. Growing older and wiser should be role-played, not purchased.
In game terms, characters change in more measurable ways – they gain Experience Points that represent all of the things that they learn over time. These Experience Points can be spent to improve a character’s Attributes, Skills, and Talents – raising his power and versatility.
SPACE1889.BlockDesc:
Instead of making an attack, your character attempts to block all Brawl attacks made against her during the turn. If she is attacked, make an opposed Brawl roll against her opponent, including any appropriate Defense modifiers. If you roll more successes than her opponent, the blow is blocked and does no damage. If he rolls more successes than you, your character takes damage equal to the number of extra successes he rolled.
Normally, only Brawl attacks may be blocked. If your character wants to block a Melee attack, she suffers a −2 on the attempt.
Special: Because your character is actively trying to block Brawl attacks, her normal Defense rating does not apply. She retains her normal Defense rating against other kinds of attacks, however.
SPACE1889.ParryDesc:
Instead of making an attack, your character attempts to parry all Melee attacks made against him. He must have a shield or be holding an appropriate weapon in order to perform this manoeuver. If he is attacked, make an opposed Melee roll against his opponent, including any shield or weapon bonuses, and any appropriate Defense modifiers. If you roll more success than she does, the strike is parried and does no damage. If she rolls more successes than you, your character takes damage equal to the number of extra successes she rolled.
Normally, only Melee attacks can be parried. If your character wishes to parry a Brawl attack, he may do so, and will inflict damage on his attacker if you roll more successes on your Defense roll.
Special: Because your character is actively trying to parry Melee attacks, his normal Defense rating does not apply. Your character retains his normal Defense rating for other types of attacks, however.
SPACE1889.EvasionDesc:
Instead of making an attack, your character attempts to dodge all ranged attacks made against her during the turn. If she is attacked, make an opposed Athletics roll versus her opponent’s ranged Attack roll, including any appropriate Defense modifiers. If you roll more successes than him, the shot is dodged and does no damage. If he rolls more successes than you, your character takes damage equal to the number of extra successes he rolled.
Special: Because your character is actively trying to evade ranged attacks, her normal Defense rating does not apply. She retains her normal Defense rating against other types of attacks, however.
Note: If your character has the Acrobatics Skill, she may use that Skill in place of Athletics when dodging ranged attacks.

SPACE1889.SpeciSkillDescGelaendebedingun: Here, a specific terrain must be chosen, for example, jungle, city, polar area, sea or desert.
SPACE1889.SpeciSkillDescLogistik: Transportation and supply of military units
SPACE1889.SpeciSkillDescMilitaerorganisa: Knowledge of military organization and chains of command.
SPACE1889.SpeciSkillDescStrategie: Planning and execution of military campaigns
SPACE1889.SpeciSkillDescTaktik: Effective use of military units in battle
SPACE1889.SkillDescAkrobatik:
Base Attribute: Dexterity

Acrobatics represents experience and training in performing highly demanding physical feats such as contortion, juggling, and tumbling. This skill is often performed before an audience, but has more practical uses as well, such as balancing on a narrow ledge or breaking a fall. Characters with this Skill can substitute their Acrobatics rating for Dexterity rolls.

Your character can specialize in the following activities:

  • Balance: The ability to keep balance in risky and dangerous situations
  • Breakfall: The ability to break a fall and take less damage
  • Contortion: Your character’s ability to contort her body into unusual shapes
  • Juggling: The ability to juggle multiple objects simultaneously
  • Tumbling: The ability to roll, flip, and jump with grace and style
SPACE1889.SkillDescBuehnenkunst:
Base Attribute: Charisma

Performance represents the talent for entertaining people through performance arts such as acting, dancing, or singing. It also covers playing musical instruments and delivering a rousing speech. Characters with this skill are fun and interesting, entertaining, and can often move their audience to laughter or tears.

Your character can specialize in the following performance arts:

  • Acting: The ability to play the part of a character or impersonate a specific person
  • Dancing: The ability to jump and dance with style and grace
  • Musical Instrument: The ability to play a particular musical instrument with precision and flair
  • Oratory: The ability to deliver a persuasive and motivational speech
  • Singing: The ability to sing with power and subtlety, with or without music
SPACE1889.SkillDescBuerokratie:
Base Attribute: Intelligence

Bureaucracy represents knowledge and understanding of administration and organization. It also includes familiarity with different kinds of power structures such as business enterprises, academic institutions, and various levels of government. Characters with this skill know how to manipulate the system to get what they want.

Your character can specialize in the following organizations:

  • Academia: Knowledge and understanding of university policies
  • Business: The ability to manage and run a business enterprise
  • Government: Knowledge and understanding of governmental regulations
  • Legal: The ability to understand and navigate the legal system
  • Military: Knowledge and understanding of military protocol
SPACE1889.SkillDescDiplomatie:
Base Attribute: Charisma

Diplomacy represents experience and training in handling various social situations. This covers leadership, etiquette, and politics. It also covers negotiation and swaying others to a particular point of view. Your character is inspiring and has the ability to motivate others. Characters with this skill can substitute their Diplomacy rating for Charisma rolls.

Your character can specialize in the following fields:

  • Etiquette: The ability to act appropriately in a variety of situations
  • Leadership: The ability to motivate and inspire others
  • Negotiation: The ability to bargain with someone and make a deal
  • Persuasion: The ability to sway others to a particular point of view
  • Politics: The ability to obtain and hold on to political power
SPACE1889.SkillDescEinschuechtern:
Base Attribute: Charisma

Intimidation represents the ability to browbeat and frighten people. It includes making threats, barking orders, and interrogation. If the situation calls for it, your character can even torture someone to get what he wants. Characters with this skill are imposing, and generally given a wide berth.

Your character can specialize in the following activities:

  • Interrogation: The ability to get information out of someone verbally
  • Orders: The ability to get someone to obey direct orders
  • Staredown: The ability to get someone to back down by staring at them
  • Threats: Your character’s ability to scare someone into giving him what he wants
  • Torture: Your character’s ability to physically or psychologically torture someone to get what he wants
SPACE1889.SkillDescEmpathie:
Base Attribute: Intelligence

Empathy represents the ability to read people and understand their feelings and motivations. This includes interpreting body language and detecting lies, as well as general intuition and gut feelings about a situation. Characters with this skill have very good instincts and are hard to fool.

Your character can specialize in the following areas:

  • Body Language: The ability to accurately read another’s body language
  • Emotions: The ability to correctly identify someone’s emotional state
  • Intuition: The ability to get the feel of an ambiguous situation
  • Lies: The ability to detect when someone is lying
  • Motives: The ability to figure out someone’s true motivation
SPACE1889.SkillDescErmittlung:
Base Attribute: Intelligence

Investigation represents the ability to search for clues and uncover evidence. It also includes researching information and piecing together the clues that your character discovers. Your character is able to interview someone to get their story or get his questions answered. Characters with this skill are able to unravel virtually any mystery. Characters with this skill can substitute their Investigation rating for Intelligence rolls.

Your character can specialize in the following activities:

  • Crimes: The ability to investigate crime scenes and look for clues
  • Enigmas: The ability to unravel mysteries and solve enigmas and riddles
  • Interview: The ability to interview someone and get answers to questions
  • Research: The ability to do legwork and research to find answers
  • Search: The ability to search an area for clues and hiding places
SPACE1889.SkillDescFahren:
Base Attribute: Dexterity

Drive represents the ability to drive a variety of land vehicles. This covers not only automobiles, and carriages, bicycles, but also tracked vehicles. Characters with this skill are able to drive with speed and precision, perform dangerous stunts, and maneuver with ease.

Your character can specialize in the following vehicles:

  • Automobile: The ability to drive engine-powered vehicles
  • Cycle: The ability to ride unmotorized vehicles (bicycles, unicycles, and penny-farthings)
  • Tracked vehicle: The ability to drive all vehicles that are – at least partially – tracked rather than wheeled; especially experimental vehicles
  • Carriage: The ability to drive a carriage (sulkies, droschkies, Hansom cabs, etc.)
  • Locomotive: The ability to drive all vehicles running on rails.
SPACE1889.SkillDescFokussieren:
Base Attribute: Willpower

Those who have learned to focus their willpower are able to ignore distractions. This skill includes meditation and overcoming fear, as well as resistance to torture and manipulation. Purposeful training in this skill is rare in Western society, but it can be learned through experience. A character with this skill can use it for Willpower tests.

Your character can specialize in the following activities:

  • Focus: Block out or ignore distractions
  • Meditate: clear the mind and find inner peace
  • Unshakeable: overcome your own fears in life-threatening situations
  • Resist: Resist torture and interrogation
  • Strong-willed: Resist manipulation and suppress emotional outbursts
SPACE1889.SkillDescGassenwissen:
Base Attribute: Charisma

Streetwise represents the ability to get information and items from the criminal underworld. It includes buying and selling items on the black market, haggling over prices, and scrounging for used items. It also covers carousing, gathering information, and rumor-mongering. Characters with this skill are well informed and able to get their hands on virtually any item.

Your character can specialize in the following areas:

  • Black Market: A talent for buying and selling items on the black market
  • Carousing: A talent for getting into nightclubs and having a good time
  • Haggling: A talent for getting items and services for lower prices
  • Rumors: A talent for gathering information and spreading rumors
  • Scrounging: A talent for tracking down used or discarded items
SPACE1889.SkillDescGaunerei:
Base Attribute: Dexterity

Larceny represents an aptitude for stealing and robbing. It covers everything from petty theft such as picking someone’s pocket, to disabling an alarm system and cracking a safe. Characters with this skill are able to steal anything that catches their eye, no matter how tricky the security.

Your character can specialize in the following activities:

  • Lockpicking: The ability to pick a lock using any available tools
  • Pickpocketing: The ability to pick someone’s pocket without anyone noticing
  • Safecracking: The ability to crack a safe using a variety of methods
  • Security: The ability to set up or bypass security systems and alarms
  • Sleight of Hand: The ability to palm small items and perform magic tricks
SPACE1889.SkillDescGeschuetze:
Base Attribute: Intelligence

Gunnery represents skill and accuracy with emplaced and vehicle-mounted weapons. It covers artillery, bombs, cannons, and more exotic weapons such as rockets and torpedoes. Characters with this skill are able to destroy enemies with various types of heavy weapons.

Your character can specialize in the following weapons:

  • Artillery: Skill with mortars, field guns, and other indirect fire weapons
  • Bombs: Skill with bombs, depth charges, and other unguided weapons
  • Cannons: Skill with cannons, tank guns, and other direct fire weapons
  • Machineguns: Skill with automatic and non-automatic machineguns, Mitrailleuses
  • Rockets: Rockets, torpedoes, and other guided weapons
SPACE1889.SkillDescHeimlichkeit:
Base Attribute: Dexterity

Stealth represents the ability to avoid detection in a variety of circumstances. It covers shadowing someone, hiding, and sneaking about. It also includes your character’s affinity for disguising herself and others. Characters with this skill leave no trace of where they have been and are hard to detect. Note: Your character’s Size rating modifies your Stealth rolls. It is harder for larger characters to go unnoticed, while smaller characters are more difficult to spot.

Your character can specialize in the following activities:

  • Camouflage: The ability to hide objects or people by blending them into the surroundings
  • Disguise: Your character’s ability to disguise herself
  • Hiding: The ability to hide by blending into the surroundings
  • Shadowing: The ability to follow someone without being spotted
  • Sneaking: The ability to move without being seen or heard
SPACE1889.SkillDescKenner:
Base Attribute: Intelligence

The connoisseur understands the different aspects of fine living. He knows which cultural achievements are currently in fashion and which consumer goods men and women of the world enjoy. He can identify corresponding things, recognize their origin or their producers and also assess their quality. In particular, he also masters the vocabulary to talk about it, to praise it or to criticize it harshly.

The skill does not include the creation of artistic works or high-quality products, but theoretical knowledge of the use of certain ingredients or techniques. It can be used to create common ground or to impress or exclude the less knowledgeable. A connoisseur can also, for example, identify the type and brand of a cigar and may even be able to tell from the remains of ashes how a cigar was smoked.

Your character can specialize in the following areas:

  • Beverages: Identify and judge wines and other beverages based on taste and bouquet.
  • Culinary art: recognize and evaluate the composition, preparation and ingredients of dishes.
  • Music: Know and enjoy composers and music.
  • Art: Knowing and appreciating artists, techniques and works.
  • Tobacco: Recognize smell, taste, brands and origin of cigars.
  • Technology: know well-known inventors and their styles, builds, brands and specifications of vehicles and aircraft.
SPACE1889.SkillDescKriegsfuehrung:
Base Attribute: Intelligence

This skill includes knowledge and experience in waging war and fighting. It can be studied theoretically or acquired through practical experience in combat. Long-term strategies and logistical planning are just as important as the deployment and organization of small units. A character with this skill is able to outwit and outmaneuver opponents on the battlefield, or simply to hold out longer.

Your character can specialize in the following areas:

  • Terrain conditions: A specific terrain must be selected here, for example jungle, city, polar region, lake or desert.
  • Logistics: transport and supply of military units
  • Military Organization: Knowledge of military organization and chains of command
  • Strategy: planning and executing war campaigns
  • Tactics: effective use of military units in battle
SPACE1889.SkillDescLinguistik:
Base Attribute: Intelligence

Linguistics represents knowledge and understanding of language structure. It covers encrypting written messages, translating spoken languages, reading lips, and understanding gestures. It also represents the number of additional languages your character speaks. Characters with this skill are proficient translators and usually fluent in many different languages.

Your character can specialize in the following areas:

  • Codes: The ability to encrypt languages and break secret codes
  • Deciphering: The ability to decipher texts, carvings, or tablets
  • Gestures: The ability to communicate through the use of expressive gestures
  • Lip Reading: The ability to understand someone by reading their lips
  • Translation: The ability to translate spoken words from one language to another
SPACE1889.SkillDescMedizin:
Base Attribute: Intelligence

Medicine represents medical training and experience. It covers the diagnosis and treatment of diseases for both humans and animals. It also includes bandaging wounds and performing surgery. Characters with this skill are able to treat illnesses, tend to wounds, and save people’s lives.

Your character can specialize in the following fields:

  • Diagnosis: The ability to diagnose an illness by observing the patient’s symptoms
  • Diseases: The ability to prevent and treat a disease with the proper medication
  • First Aid: The ability to bandage wounds, stop bleeding, and revive a patient
  • Surgery: The ability to perform necessary surgery to correct a medical condition
  • Veterinary: The ability to examine and treat animal maladies
SPACE1889.SkillDescNahkampf:
Base Attribute: Strength

Melee represents proficiency with a variety of handheld weapons. It includes common weapons such as clubs and knives, as well as more archaic weapons such as bayonets, axes, swords, and spears. Characters with this skill are deadly with virtually any hand-held weapon.

Your character can specialize in the following weapons:

  • Axes: Proficiency with axes, polearms, and other chopping weapons
  • Clubs: Proficiency with maces, clubs, and other blunt weapons
  • Knives: Proficiency with knives and other small bladed weapons
  • Spears: Proficiency with spears, lances, and other extended weapons
  • Swords: Proficiency with swords, rapiers, and other bladed weapons
SPACE1889.SkillDescPrimitiverFernkampf:
Base Attribute: Dexterity

Archery represents proficiency with primitive ranged weapons, including bows, crossbows, and slings. It also covers the use of more exotic weapons such as blowguns, nets, and bolas. This skill is more common among primitive peoples and those who have spent time living among them.

Your character can specialize in the following weapons:

  • Blowguns: Proficiency with blowguns and other breath-powered weapon
  • Bows: Proficiency with short bows, longbows, and various arrows types
  • Crossbows: Proficiency with different crossbows and types of bolt
  • Nets: Proficiency with nets and other ranged entanglement weapons
  • Slings: Proficiency with slings and various projectile types
SPACE1889.SkillDescReiten:
Base Attribute: Dexterity

Riding represents your character’s aptitude for riding expertly and control a mount in combat. Possible mounts include horses, mules, and camels, but also species from other planets such as pacyosaurus and gashants.

Your character can specialize in the following mounts:

  • Bulls
  • Camels
  • Elephants
  • Gashants
  • Horses
  • Mules
  • Pacyosaurus
  • Ruumet Breehr
  • Skrill
SPACE1889.SkillDescSchusswaffen:
Base Attribute: Dexterity

Firearms represents proficiency with guns and firearms. This includes pistols, rifles, shotguns, and archaic black powder weapons. Characters with this skill are able to shoot and maintain all manner of firearms with skill and accuracy.

Your character can specialize in the following weapons:

  • Archaic: Proficiency with black powder pistols and rifles
  • Pistol: Proficiency with all calibers of pistols and revolvers
  • Rifle: Proficiency with all calibers of rifles and carbines
  • Shotgun: Proficiency with all gauges of shotguns
SPACE1889.SkillDescSchwindeln:
Base Attribute: Charisma

Con represents a talent for lies and deception. It covers bluffing, fast-talking, seduction, and tricking others. Characters with this skill may get what they want, but they are mistrusted and may have to quickly move on before the marks realize they have been duped.

Your character can specialize in the following deceptions:

  • Bluff: Your character’s ability to appear stronger or weaker than she really is
  • Fast Talk: Your character’s ability to get what she wants by fast-talking someone
  • Lying: The ability to lie convincingly and with sincerity
  • Tricks: Your character’s ability to trick someone into doing what she wants
  • Seduction: The ability to seduce someone with charm and wit
SPACE1889.SkillDescSpielen:
Base Attribute: Intelligence

Gambling represents expertise at games of skill and chance. It covers classic games such as poker, bridge, craps, and roulette. It also includes chess and more exotic games. Characters with this skill have better than average luck and usually walk away from the gaming table with more money than they started with.

Your character can specialize in the following games:

  • Cheating: The ability to cheat at a variety of games of chance
  • Bridge: Skill at playing bridge, and knowledge of its variant rules
  • Craps: Skill at playing craps, and knowledge of its variant rules
  • Poker: Skill at playing poker, and knowledge of its variant rules
  • Roulette: Skill at playing roulette, and knowledge of its variant rules
SPACE1889.SkillDescSportlichkeit:
Base Attribute: Strength

Athletics represents a talent for performing common physical activities such as running, jumping, and swimming. It also covers climbing and throwing – including throwing weapons in combat. Characters with this Skill can substitute their Athletics rating for both their Move rating and Strength rolls.

Your character can specialize in the following abilities:

  • Climbing: The ability to scale trees, walls, and other obstacles
  • Jumping: The ability to leap horizontally or vertically into the air
  • Running: The ability to run over short and long distances
  • Swimming: The ability to swim across rivers, lakes, and other bodies of water
  • Throwing: The ability to throw objects accurately and over a great distance
SPACE1889.SkillDescSprengstoffe:
Base Attribute: Intelligence

Demolitions represents an ability to set and defuse bombs and explosives. This includes the handling of dynamite, gunpowder, and TNT. It also includes making homemade and improvised explosive devices. Characters with this skill are able to create tunnels and mines, as well as raze buildings and structures.

Your character can specialize in the following explosives:

  • Defusing: The ability to disarm and dispose of explosive devices
  • Dynamite: The ability to work with dynamite and nitroglycerin
  • Gunpowder: The ability to work with black powder Explosives
  • Improvised: The ability to work with homemade explosives
  • Incendiary: The ability to work with napalm and Greek fire
SPACE1889.SkillDescTierhaltung:
Base Attribute: Charisma

Animal Handling represents the ability to train and care for animals.This covers befriending or domesticating an animal, working with it, and teaching it basic commands. Not all animals are capable of learning tricks, and wild animals are unlikely to obey commands until your character has earned their trust.

Your character can specialize in the following animals:

  • Cats: The ability to work with cats, tigers, and other large felines
  • Dogs: The ability to work with dogs, wolves, and other canines
  • Horses: The ability to work with horses, mules, and donkeys
  • Birds: The ability to work with carrier pigeons, falcons, and other birds
  • Reptiles: The ability to work with lizards, snakes, and other reptiles
SPACE1889.SkillDescUeberleben:
Base Attribute: Intelligence

Survival represents your character’s ability to find food and shelter in the wild. It also covers navigation, and hunting and tracking game. Characters with this skill are at home in the wilderness and can not only take care of themselves, they can also feed and guide others.

Your character can specialize in the following activities:

  • Foraging: The ability to gather edible plants and find sources of fresh water
  • Hunting: The ability to find, trap, and kill animals for food or clothing
  • Navigation: The ability to determine general location and direction of travel
  • Shelter: The ability to build or locate suitable shelter from the elements
  • Tracking: The ability to follow the tracks of people and animals
SPACE1889.SkillDescWaffenlos:
Base Attribute: Strength

Brawl represents your character’s ability to fight with his bare hands. It covers everything from disciplined martial arts maneuvers to clawing and biting. Characters with this skill are not only adept at hand-to-hand combat, they are able to easily knockdown, incapacitate, or throw their opponents.

Your character can specialize in the following attacks:

  • Dirty Tricks: The ability to do whatever it takes to hurt anopponent
  • Grappling: The ability to grapple and immobilize an opponent
  • Kicking: The ability to use knees and feet to hurt an opponent
  • Punching: The ability to use hands and elbows to hurt an opponent
  • Throws: The ability to flip an opponent or knock him to the ground
SPACE1889.TalentDescAbgehaertetElektrizi:
Voraussetzung: Konstitution 3

Der Charakter ist erstaunlich resistent gegen eine bestimmte Art von Umweltschaden und kann deswegen ohne Probleme mit Dingen oder Naturgewalten umgehen, die bei anderen schmerzhafte Wunden erzeugen würden.

Regeln: Sie können die Passive Abwehr des Charakters benutzen, wenn er den Schaden aus Feuer (GRW S. 230), Elektrizität (GRW S. 229) oder Gift (GRW S. 231) abschütteln will: Wählen Sie beim Erwerb dieses Talents eine der genannten Arten aus.

Höchste Stufe: 3. Für jede zusätzliche Stufe erhält der Charakter 2 Zusatzwürfel für seine Passive Abwehr gegen diese spezielle Schadensart. Alternativ kann sich eine neue Stufe auch auf eine weitere Schadensart beziehen.
SPACE1889.TalentDescAbgehaertetFeuer:
Voraussetzung: Konstitution 3

Der Charakter ist erstaunlich resistent gegen eine bestimmte Art von Umweltschaden und kann deswegen ohne Probleme mit Dingen oder Naturgewalten umgehen, die bei anderen schmerzhafte Wunden erzeugen würden.

Regeln: Sie können die Passive Abwehr des Charakters benutzen, wenn er den Schaden aus Feuer (GRW S. 230), Elektrizität (GRW S. 229) oder Gift (GRW S. 231) abschütteln will: Wählen Sie beim Erwerb dieses Talents eine der genannten Arten aus.

Höchste Stufe: 3. Für jede zusätzliche Stufe erhält der Charakter 2 Zusatzwürfel für seine Passive Abwehr gegen diese spezielle Schadensart. Alternativ kann sich eine neue Stufe auch auf eine weitere Schadensart beziehen.
SPACE1889.TalentDescAbgehaertetGift:
Voraussetzung: Konstitution 3

Der Charakter ist erstaunlich resistent gegen eine bestimmte Art von Umweltschaden und kann deswegen ohne Probleme mit Dingen oder Naturgewalten umgehen, die bei anderen schmerzhafte Wunden erzeugen würden.

Regeln: Sie können die Passive Abwehr des Charakters benutzen, wenn er den Schaden aus Feuer (GRW S. 230), Elektrizität (GRW S. 229) oder Gift (GRW S. 231) abschütteln will: Wählen Sie beim Erwerb dieses Talents eine der genannten Arten aus.

Höchste Stufe: 3. Für jede zusätzliche Stufe erhält der Charakter 2 Zusatzwürfel für seine Passive Abwehr gegen diese spezielle Schadensart. Alternativ kann sich eine neue Stufe auch auf eine weitere Schadensart beziehen.
SPACE1889.TalentDescAnfuehrer:
Prerequisites: Diplomacy 4

Your character is skilled at motivating others. He can infect people with his confidence and enthusiasm, and drive them to perform better than they thought possible.

Benefit: As an attack action, your character can grant a +2 Skill bonus to all allies within 10 feet of him. He must be able to see and speak to his allies in order to grant this bonus.

Advanced: You can buy this Talent twice, allowing your character to provide an additional +2 Skill bonus to allies.
SPACE1889.TalentDescAngenehmerGeruch:
Voraussetzung: Keine

Ihr Charakter hat einen angenehmen Körpergeruch. Die meisten Personen nehmen dies nur unterschwellig war, Kreaturen, die sich auf ihren Geruchssinn verlassen, werden hiervon jedoch stark beeinﬂusst.

Regeln: Charaktere mit angenehmem Geruch erhalten auf alle gesellschaftlichen Proben im Umgang mit Kreaturen, deren Geruchssinn eine wichtige Sinneswahrnehmung ist (Hunde, aber auch Venusier), einen Bonus von 2 Würfeln. Für andere Kreaturen (Menschen oder Marsianer) ist der Geruch zwar wahrnehmbar, es bleibt aber ein rein kosmetischer Effekt.

Höchste Stufe: Einmalig
SPACE1889.TalentDescAssassine:
Voraussetzung: Heimlichkeit 4

Der Charakter ist ein meisterlicher Meuchelmörder und kann sich einem Opfer unbemerkt nähern, indem er sich anschleicht oder aber verstellt.

Regeln: Wenn Ihr Charakter jemanden im Nahkampf angreifen will, der ihn bisher noch nicht bemerkt hat, können Sie hierzu den Heimlichkeits-Wert verwenden. Würfeln Sie eine Probe (unter Beachtung eventueller Waffenmodifikationen) gegen die Passive Abwehr des Opfers (plus Rüstungsmodifikatoren). Für jeden zusätzlichen Erfolg, der Ihnen gelingt, erleidet das Opfer einen Punkt Schaden. Reichen Ihre Erfolge nicht, um die Passive Abwehr zu übertreffen, ist der Angriff misslungen. Sobald Ihr Charakter das Opfer angegriffen hat, ist das Überraschungsmoment vergeben und er kann das Assassinen-Talent kein zweites Mal gegen die gleiche Person anwenden (außer er zieht sich zurück und kann sie erneut überraschen).

Höchste Stufe: 3. Jede weitere Stufe verleiht 2 zusätzliche Angriffswürfel für den Überraschungsangriff.
SPACE1889.TalentDescAethertaucher:
Voraussetzung: Geeignete Spezies, z.B. Grauer Selenit

Dieser Charakter hat ein außergewöhnliches Lungenvolumen und kann die Luft viel länger anhalten als andere und für die gleiche Zeit auch im Vakuum überleben.

Regeln: Normale Charaktere können die Luft eine Minute lang pro Punkt Konstitution anhalten, beziehungsweise im Kampf für eine Runde pro Erfolg in einer instinktiven Konstitutionsprobe. Ein Äthertaucher hingegen schafft die dreißigfache Zeit, also 30 Minuten mal Konstitution bzw. 30 Runden pro Erfolg.

Höchste Stufe: 1
SPACE1889.TalentDescAufmerksamkeit:
Prerequisites: None

Your character is remarkably attentive to his surroundings. He is vigilant and rarely lets his guard down.

Benefit: Your character gains a +2 Perception rating.

Advanced: You can purchase this Talent twice, gaining your character an additional +2 Perception rating for a total of +4.
SPACE1889.TalentDescAufspringen:
Prerequisites: None

Your character can get back on his feet with amazing speed and grace. When knocked to the ground, he immediately bounces up again.

Benefit: Normally, standing up takes an attack action. If your character possesses the Kip Up Talent he stands up as a reflexive action, allowing him to get up and attack in the same turn.

Advanced: This Talent is Unique.
SPACE1889.TalentDescAusbrecherkoenig:
Voraussetzung: Akrobatik 4

Dieser Charakter kann sich aus engsten Räumen herauswinden, aus dem Griff eines Ringers schlüpfen und Handschellen abstreifen.

Regeln: Der Charakter kann seinen Körper so verdrehen, dass er aus fast jeder Umklammerung oder Fesselung entkommt. Dazu muss ihm eine Akrobatikprobe gelingen, deren Erfolgsschwelle von den Umständen abhängt:

● fachmännische Fesselung der Handgelenke: 2

● durch das Gitter eines Bambuskäfigs quetschen: 3

● durch das Gitter eines Eisenkäfigs quetschen: 4

● einer Zwangsjacke entkommen: 5

Dieses Talent bringt keinen Bonus beim Öffnen eines Schlosses, sodass ein Charakter zwar seine eigenen Handschellen abstreifen, aber die Gefährten deswegen noch nicht befreien kann. Und auch aus einem dicht verschlossenen Raum kann man mit diesem Talent natürlich nicht entkommen. Außerdem kann ein Ausbrecherkönig mit einer Akrobatikprobe statt der üblichen Stärkeprobe versuchen, sich aus dem Griff eines Gegners zu befreien, der ihn festzuhalten versucht.

Höchste Stufe: 3. Für jede weitere Stufe erhält der Ausbrecherkönig 4 Zusatzwürfel für seine Befreiungsversuche.
SPACE1889.TalentDescAusweichen:
Prerequisites: Athletics 4

Your character has an innate ability to avoid ranged combat attacks. She expertly ducks and weaves, making herself harder to hit.

Benefit: Your character performs the Dodge maneuver as a reflexive action (see Dodge, p. 206). Any Defense bonuses provide a bonus to the Dodge maneuver as well. If your character loses her Active Defense, she loses her Dodge ability as well.

Advanced: You can purchase this Talent up to three times, each time gaining your character an additional +1 Defense bonus against ranged combat attacks.
SPACE1889.TalentDescAusweichmanoever:
Voraussetzung: Fahren o. Spezielle Fahrzeuge 4

Ausweichmanöver als Instinktive Aktion

Höchste Stufe: 3
SPACE1889.TalentDescAutofeuer:
Prerequisites: Firearms 4

Your character is highly proficient at shooting fully automatic weapons, and she knows how to use them to their full, deadly potential.

Benefit: Your character receives a +1 bonus on all autofire attacks. This bonus stacks with the normal autofire bonuses (See Autofire p. 205).

Advanced: You can buy this Talent twice, gaining your character an additional +1 autofire bonus, for a total bonus of +2. This bonus again stacks with the normal autofire bonuses.
SPACE1889.TalentDescBastler:
Prerequisites: Craft (any) 4

Your character always has the right tool at hand – and if he does not, he can improvise one using everyday items around him.

Benefit: Normally, a character suffers a –2 penalty on all Skill rolls when using improvised tools on a task that cannot be done without the right equipment. A character with the Tinker Talent can ignore this penalty since he is used to collecting and improvising the necessary tools.

Advanced: You can buy this Talent up to three times. Your character can ignore an additional –2 penalty per level for using improvised tools.
SPACE1889.TalentDescBegabung:
Prerequisites: None

Your character has a natural affinity for a particular activity or subject matter and is considered a prodigy or expert in her field.

Benefit: Your character gains +2 Skill rating to a specific Skill (designate one when you take this Talent). This is a general bonus and does not give your character any free Skill Levels.

Advanced: You can buy this Talent multiple times, but the benefit is applied to a different Skill each time.
SPACE1889.TalentDescBeidhaendig:
Prerequisites: Dexterity 3

Your character can wield a weapon in each hand, doubling the amount of damage he can inflict on his enemies.

Benefit: Your character can attack without penalty when using a weapon in his off-hand. Alternately, he can attack two times – using one weapon in each hand – by making a Total Attack with a –4 penalty on each attack roll. These attacks can be made at different targets.

Normally, attacking with a weapon in your character’s off-hand results in a –2 penalty, the penalty for making a Total Attack is even higher (see Total Attack, p. 207).

Advanced: You can buy this Talent up to three times. Each additional level reduces the Total Attack penalty by 2.
SPACE1889.TalentDescBerechneteAbwehr:
Prerequisites: Intelligence 3

Your character is shrewd and smart, anticipating his opponent’s attacks and expertly defending against them.

Benefit: Your character uses his Intelligence instead of Dexterity when calculating his Active Defense and Defense ratings.

Advanced: This Talent is Unique.

Special: You cannot buy this Talent if your character already has the Bold Defense Talent.
SPACE1889.TalentDescBerechneterNahkampfA:
Prerequisites: Intelligence 3

Your character is wily and clever, able to use her intellect as a weapon. She knows how to take advantage of an opponent’s mistakes and exploit weaknesses in defenses.

Benefit: Your character uses her Intelligence rating as the Base Attribute for a specific combat Skill, such as Archery, Athletics, Brawl, Firearms, or Melee (designate one when you take this Talent).

Advanced: You can buy this Talent multiple times, but the benefit is applied to a different Skill each time.
SPACE1889.TalentDescBerechneterPrimitive:
Prerequisites: Intelligence 3

Your character is wily and clever, able to use her intellect as a weapon. She knows how to take advantage of an opponent’s mistakes and exploit weaknesses in defenses.

Benefit: Your character uses her Intelligence rating as the Base Attribute for a specific combat Skill, such as Archery, Athletics, Brawl, Firearms, or Melee (designate one when you take this Talent).

Advanced: You can buy this Talent multiple times, but the benefit is applied to a different Skill each time.
SPACE1889.TalentDescBerechneterSchusswaf:
Prerequisites: Intelligence 3

Your character is wily and clever, able to use her intellect as a weapon. She knows how to take advantage of an opponent’s mistakes and exploit weaknesses in defenses.

Benefit: Your character uses her Intelligence rating as the Base Attribute for a specific combat Skill, such as Archery, Athletics, Brawl, Firearms, or Melee (designate one when you take this Talent).

Advanced: You can buy this Talent multiple times, but the benefit is applied to a different Skill each time.
SPACE1889.TalentDescBerechneterSportlich:
Prerequisites: Intelligence 3

Your character is wily and clever, able to use her intellect as a weapon. She knows how to take advantage of an opponent’s mistakes and exploit weaknesses in defenses.

Benefit: Your character uses her Intelligence rating as the Base Attribute for a specific combat Skill, such as Archery, Athletics, Brawl, Firearms, or Melee (designate one when you take this Talent).

Advanced: You can buy this Talent multiple times, but the benefit is applied to a different Skill each time.
SPACE1889.TalentDescBerechneterWaffenlos:
Prerequisites: Intelligence 3

Your character is wily and clever, able to use her intellect as a weapon. She knows how to take advantage of an opponent’s mistakes and exploit weaknesses in defenses.

Benefit: Your character uses her Intelligence rating as the Base Attribute for a specific combat Skill, such as Archery, Athletics, Brawl, Firearms, or Melee (designate one when you take this Talent).

Advanced: You can buy this Talent multiple times, but the benefit is applied to a different Skill each time.
SPACE1889.TalentDescBerittenerSturmangri:
Voraussetzung: Reiten 4

Der Charakter kann sein Reittier gegen einen Gegner lenken und den gesamten Schwung des Tiers in die Kraft seines Angriffs legen. Dies gilt auch für geeignete Flugtiere, wie z.B. die Skrill der marsianischen Queln.

Regeln: Wenn der Reiter auf einem bereitwilligen Tier (S. 74) sitzt, und ihm einen Sturmangriff befiehlt, erhalten Charakter und Reittier die 2 zusätzlichen Angriffswürfel für einen Sturmangriff (GRW S. 220), ohne dadurch ihre Aktive Abwehr zu verlieren.

Höchste Stufe: 3. Sowohl Reiter als auch Reittier erhalten für jede weitere Stufe 4 zusätzliche Würfel für ihre Sturmangriffe.
SPACE1889.TalentDescBerserker:
Voraussetzung: Willenskraft 3

Der Charakter kann sich in einen Kampfrausch versetzen, was seine Kraft und Aggressivität auf Kosten der eigenen Gesundheit steigen lässt.

Regeln: Als freie Aktion kann der Charakter freiwillig einen Punkt nicht tödlichen Schaden hinnehmen und erhält dadurch bis zum Ende dieser Kampfrunde 2 Zusatzwürfel für alle stärkebasierten Fertigkeits- und Attributs-Proben.

Höchste Stufe: 3. Auf der zweiten Stufe erhält der Charakter 4 statt 2 Zusatzwürfel, auf der dritten sogar 8.
SPACE1889.TalentDescBetaeubungsschlag:
Prerequisites: Brawl 4

Your character is a master of nonlethal combat. She knows exactly where to hit an opponent to daze him without hurting him very much.

Benefit: Normally, your character’s unmodified damage is compared to your opponent’s Stun rating. If she inflicts more damage than her target’s Stun rating, her opponent will be stunned for one turn per additional success. If she inflicts more damage than twice her opponent’s Stun rating, her opponent will be knocked out for one minute per additional success. If your character possesses the Knockout Blow Talent she gains a +1 damage bonus to stun or knockout her opponent (see below).

Advanced: You can buy this Talent up to four times. Each level grants your character an additional +1 damage bonus to stun her opponent.
SPACE1889.TalentDescBeweglicheAbwehr:
Prerequisites: Dexterity 3

Your character keeps up an active defense – always moving and turning to keep his opponents at bay. Even multiple opponents have difficulty wearing him down!

Benefit: If attacked more than once during the same combat turn, a character normally suffers a –2 penalty to his Defense rating for each additional attack. If your character possesses the Vigorous Defense Talent he can be attacked twice in the same combat turn without penalty. Additional attacks penalize his Defense rating as normal.

Advanced: You can buy this Talent up to four times. Your character can defend against an extra attack per combat turn without penalty for each additional level. In other words, the initial purchase lets your character defend against one additional attack without penalty, the second allows two additional attacks, and so on.
SPACE1889.TalentDescBeweglicherKaempfer:
Prerequisites: Dexterity 3

Your character excels at fancy footwork, and can make accurate and powerful attacks even while moving.

Benefit: Normally, your character can move and attack, or attack and then move, but he cannot do both at the same time. If your character possesses the Mobile Attack Bonus he can attack without stopping his movement (up to his total Move rating).

Advanced: You can buy this Talent twice, granting your character the ability to simultaneously run and attack.
SPACE1889.TalentDescBezaubernd:
Prerequisites: Performance 4

Your character is a magnetic and attractive performer. She is able to capture attention with her performance abilities and the sheer force of her personality.

Benefit: As an attack action, your character can attempt to entrance her opponents during combat. Make a Performance roll against all opponents within 10 feet of your character. If you roll more successes than an opponent’s Willpower rating, he is beguiled by your character and unable to attack for a number of turns equal to the number of extra successes you rolled. An entranced opponent can defend himself normally, but the spell is broken if he is attacked during this time.

If you roll more than twice an opponent’s Willpower rating, he is completely enthralled and loses his Active Defense rating for a number of turns equal to the total number of extra successes you rolled.

Advanced: You can buy this Talent up to three times, gaining your character a +2 Performance bonus for each additional level purchased.
SPACE1889.TalentDescBlindkampf:
Prerequisites: None

Your character can target opponents without having to see them. He might hear them breathing, catch their scent, or feel their presence, but he always seems to know where they are.

Benefit: Normally, a character would suffer up to a –8 penalty when making an attack in the dark (see p. 208). A character with the Blind Fight Talent can ignore up to a –2 penalty due to poor visibility, for example, fighting in partial darkness or with blurred vision.

Advanced: You can buy this Talent up to four times. Your character can ignore an additional –2 visibility penalty per level.
