Anstelle von jeweils 2 Punkten nicht tödlichem Schaden richtet ein solcher Angriff einen Punkt Strukturschaden an. Überzähliger Schaden hat nur noch Auswirkungen auf das Aussehen des Gegenstands.

Höchste Stufe: 3. Auf Stufe 2 erhält der Charakter 2 zusätzliche Würfel für Kampfkunst- oder Waffenlose Angriffe auf Gegenstände, auf Stufe 3 sogar insgesamt 4 Zusatzwürfel.
SPACE1889.TalentDescUeberzeugteAbwehr:
Prerequisites: Willpower 3

Your character is stubborn and unyielding. She focuses her will to defend herself, shrugging off blows and never letting her guard down.

Benefit: Your character uses her Willpower instead of Body when calculating her Passive Defense and Defense ratings.

Advanced: This Talent is Unique.

Special: You cannot buy this Talent if your character already has the Strong Defense Talent.
SPACE1889.TalentDescUeberzeugterNahkampf:
Prerequisites: Willpower 3

Your character is dogged and relentless, able to use his discipline as a weapon. She focuses his attacks to wear down an opponent’s defenses.

Benefit: Your character uses his Willpower rating as the Base Attribute for a specific combat Skill, such as Archery, Athletics, Brawl, Firearms, or Melee (designate one when you take this Talent).

Advanced: You can buy this Talent multiple times, but the benefit is applied to a different Skill each time.
SPACE1889.TalentDescUeberzeugterPrimitiv:
Prerequisites: Willpower 3

Your character is dogged and relentless, able to use his discipline as a weapon. She focuses his attacks to wear down an opponent’s defenses.

Benefit: Your character uses his Willpower rating as the Base Attribute for a specific combat Skill, such as Archery, Athletics, Brawl, Firearms, or Melee (designate one when you take this Talent).

Advanced: You can buy this Talent multiple times, but the benefit is applied to a different Skill each time.
SPACE1889.TalentDescUeberzeugterSchusswa:
Prerequisites: Willpower 3

Your character is dogged and relentless, able to use his discipline as a weapon. She focuses his attacks to wear down an opponent’s defenses.

Benefit: Your character uses his Willpower rating as the Base Attribute for a specific combat Skill, such as Archery, Athletics, Brawl, Firearms, or Melee (designate one when you take this Talent).

Advanced: You can buy this Talent multiple times, but the benefit is applied to a different Skill each time.
SPACE1889.TalentDescUeberzeugterSportlic:
Prerequisites: Willpower 3

Your character is dogged and relentless, able to use his discipline as a weapon. She focuses his attacks to wear down an opponent’s defenses.

Benefit: Your character uses his Willpower rating as the Base Attribute for a specific combat Skill, such as Archery, Athletics, Brawl, Firearms, or Melee (designate one when you take this Talent).

Advanced: You can buy this Talent multiple times, but the benefit is applied to a different Skill each time.
SPACE1889.TalentDescUeberzeugterWaffenlo:
Prerequisites: Willpower 3

Your character is dogged and relentless, able to use his discipline as a weapon. She focuses his attacks to wear down an opponent’s defenses.

Benefit: Your character uses his Willpower rating as the Base Attribute for a specific combat Skill, such as Archery, Athletics, Brawl, Firearms, or Melee (designate one when you take this Talent).

Advanced: You can buy this Talent multiple times, but the benefit is applied to a different Skill each time.
SPACE1889.TalentDescUniversalist:
Prerequisites: Intelligence 3

Your character has a fairly good basic knowledge in a great variety of different tasks. He could be a handyman or a tramp doing all kinds of jobs, whichever one is offered to him. He knows a bit of everything without ever having had any formal training in a field.

Benefit: Your character can ignore the penalty on all untrained Skill rolls (see p. 150). He can also make untrained Skill rolls for Skill Specializations that he does not have – in this case, however, he does suffer the –2 penalty on untrained Skill rolls.

Advanced: You can buy this Talent up to three times, gaining your character an additional +1 bonus to untrained Skill rolls per level.
SPACE1889.TalentDescUnverwuestlich:
Prerequisites: None

Your character is exceptionally hardy and robust. Her stamina and endurance far exceed that of the average person.

Benefit: Your character gains a +1 Body rating. This bonus affects her Body rolls and any Body-based Skills. It also factors into her Secondary Attributes and raises her maximum Body rating by one point.

Advanced: This Talent is Unique.
SPACE1889.TalentDescVerrueckterWissensch:
Voraussetzung: Genialität

Ein Verrückter Wissenschaftler ist besessen von boshaften Ideen, und hat zudem noch eine Begabung diese umzusetzen.

Regeln: Die Herstellungsschwierigkeit einer Erfindung wird um 1 gesenkt, minimal auf 1. Die Erfindung muss jedoch schädlich für Menschen oder andere Lebewesen sein oder anderweitig großes Unheil heraufbeschwören: Sie ist also nicht gedacht für den Heiltrank oder den leiseren Motor, wohl aber etwas für das mutierende Todesserum oder den Ätherbebengenerator.

Höchste Stufe: 3. Je weitere Stufe sinkt die Herstellungsschwierigkeit um 1.
SPACE1889.TalentDescVertrautesTerrain:
Voraussetzung: keine

Der Charakter hat sehr viel Erfahrung darin, in einer bestimmten Umgebung zu überleben, die den meisten anderen als sehr lebensfeindlich erscheint. Er findet instinktiv Nahrungsquellen und Trinkwasser, wenn er sich in diesem speziellen Terrain befindet.

Regeln: Beim Erwerb dieses Talents muss eine bestimmte Geländeart gewählt werden (zum Beispiel Arktis, Dschungel, Wüste, Gebirge etc.). Wenn der Charakter sich in dem entsprechenden Terrain aufhält, leidet er niemals unter den dortigen Auswirkungen von Entbehrungen und extremen Temperaturen (GRW S. 228 bzw. S. 230).

Höchste Stufe: 3. Jede weitere Stufe verleiht dem Charakter 2 Zusatzwürfel für Fertigkeitsproben, wenn er sich in dem spezifischen Gelände aufhält. Alternativ ist es auch möglich, sich in mehreren unterschiedlichen Terrains auszukennen.
SPACE1889.TalentDescVerzoegerterSchlag:
Voraussetzung: Kampfkunst oder Waffenlos 4

Ihr Charakter beherrscht die Kunst, die lebenswichtigen Organe eines Gegners mit einem Schlag so zu treffen, dass zunächst einmal kein größerer Schaden zu sehen ist, sondern Schmerzen und Verletzung erst zu einem späteren Zeitpunkt eintreten.

Regeln: Bei einem erfolgreichen Kampfkunst- oder Waffenlosen Angriff kann Ihr Charakter entscheiden, dass der Schaden erst bis zu zehn Kampfrunden (eine Minute) später eintritt. Bis zu dem gewählten Zeitpunkt kann er den Schaden jederzeit wieder aufheben, indem er eine entsprechend entgegengesetzte Bewegung ausführt. Für dieses Aufheben des verzögerten Schlags ist in der Regel keine Probe erforderlich, außer das Opfer versucht ihn abzuwehren. In diesem Fall müssen Sie einen entsprechenden Angriff auswürfeln, und der verzögerte Schaden sinkt um den Schaden, den Ihr Charakter bei diesem zweiten Angriff theoretisch angerichtet hätte.

Höchste Stufe: 3. Wenn Sie dieses Talent ein zweites Mal erwerben, können Sie den Schaden um bis zu eine Stunde verzögern, beim dritten Erwerb sogar um einen Tag.
SPACE1889.TalentDescVielseitigAkademisch:
Prerequisites: Intelligence 3

Your character is a genius in a particular field with expertise in all of its various disciplines. He may be a master craftsman, general scientific expert, or hotshot pilot.

Benefit: Your character take the Specialized Skill – Academics – as a general Skill, granting him general expertise in all of its disciplines.

Advanced: You can buy this Talent multiple times, but the benefit is applied to a different Skill each time.
SPACE1889.TalentDescVielseitigHandwerk:
Prerequisites: Intelligence 3

Your character is a genius in a particular field with expertise in all of its various disciplines. He may be a master craftsman, general scientific expert, or hotshot pilot.

Benefit: Your character take the Specialized Skill – Craft – as a general Skill, granting him general expertise in all of its disciplines.

Advanced: You can buy this Talent multiple times, but the benefit is applied to a different Skill each time.
SPACE1889.TalentDescVielseitigKunst:
Prerequisites: Intelligence 3

Your character is a genius in a particular field with expertise in all of its various disciplines. He may be a master craftsman, general scientific expert, or hotshot pilot.

Benefit: Your character take the Specialized Skill – Art – as a general Skill, granting him general expertise in all of its disciplines.

Advanced: You can buy this Talent multiple times, but the benefit is applied to a different Skill each time.
SPACE1889.TalentDescVielseitigNaturwisse:
Prerequisites: Intelligence 3

Your character is a genius in a particular field with expertise in all of its various disciplines. He may be a master craftsman, general scientific expert, or hotshot pilot.

Benefit: Your character take the Specialized Skill – Science – as a general Skill, granting him general expertise in all of its disciplines.

Advanced: You can buy this Talent multiple times, but the benefit is applied to a different Skill each time.
SPACE1889.TalentDescVielseitigSpezielleF:
Prerequisites: Intelligence 3

Your character is a genius in a particular field with expertise in all of its various disciplines. He may be a master craftsman, general scientific expert, or hotshot pilot.

Benefit: Your character take the Specialized Skill – Pilot – as a general Skill, granting him general expertise in all of its disciplines.

Advanced: You can buy this Talent multiple times, but the benefit is applied to a different Skill each time.
SPACE1889.TalentDescVisionaererWissensch:
Voraussetzung: Genialität

Ein Visionärer Wissenschaftler ist erfüllt von Ideen, die die Menschheit voranbringen werden und hat zudem eine Begabung diese umzusetzen.

Regeln: Die Herstellungsschwierigkeit einer Erfindung wird um 1 gesenkt, minimal auf 1. Die Erfindung muss erkennbar dem Wohle der Menschheit dienen, z.B. eine neue Medizin gegen bestimmte Krankheiten, eine emissionsreduzierende saubere Dampfmaschine, oder ein elektromagnetischer Schutzschild für Ätherschiffe vor Ätherturbulenzen; nicht aber Waffen, profitsteigernde Maschinen, etc.

Höchste Stufe: 3. Je weitere Stufe sinkt die Herstellungsschwierigkeit um 1.
SPACE1889.TalentDescVolleAbwehr:
Prerequisites: Dexterity 3

Your character is adept at defending herself and never lets her guard down. She can defend herself even while making an aggressive, reckless assault.

Benefit: Under certain circumstances, a character can only use her Active or Passive Defense rating when defending herself. However, if your character possesses the Total Defense Talent she always retains her full Defense rating.

Advanced: You can purchase this Talent up to three times, gaining your character an additional +2 Defense bonus per level.

This bonus also stacks with all other Defense modifiers and increases the benefit of the Total Defense maneuver (see Total Defense, p. 207).
SPACE1889.TalentDescWaffenloseParade:
Voraussetzung: Kampfkunst oder Waffenlos 4

Ihr Charakter kann bewaffnete Angriffe mit bloßen Händen abwehren, wobei er Klingen einfängt und Schläge abblockt, ohne selbst verletzt zu werden.

Regeln: Beim Blocken von Nahkampfangriffen erleidet der Charakter keine Würfelabzüge, wenn er selbst keine Waffe hat (GRW S. 218). Wenn der Charakter seine Aktive Abwehr verliert, kann er auch nicht mehr waffenlos parieren.

Höchste Stufe: 3. Der Charakter erhält ab Stufe 2 je Stufe 2 zusätzliche Würfel gegen Nahkampfangriffe die er mit seinen bloßen Händen abwehrt.
SPACE1889.TalentDescWandelnderSchatten:
Voraussetzung: Heimlichkeit 4

Der Charakter versteht sich darauf, so gut versteckt zu sein, dass man ihn nicht wahrnimmt. Dies gilt auch im Kampf – solange er sich im Hintergrund hält, und nicht selber aktiv wird.

Regeln: Um in den Schatten zu wandeln muss man mit einer Heimlichkeits-Probe die Wahrnehmung aller Gegner in Sichtweite übertreffen.

Höchste Stufe: 3. Jede weitere Stufe gibt Ihnen einen Bonus von 2 Würfeln für die Heimlichkeitsprobe.
SPACE1889.TalentDescWandlaeufer:
Voraussetzung: geeignete Spezies. Kann nur bei der Charaktererschaffung gewählt werden.

Die Hände und Füße dieses Charakters sind so geformt, dass sie sich an glatten Oberflächen festsaugen können, oder aber sie sind mit winzigen Härchen bedeckt, die ihm Halt an jeder Oberfläche verschaffen, die sie berühren. Dadurch kann er an fast jeder Wand hinaufklettern.

Regeln: Der Charakter kann an jeder Oberfläche und sogar an der Decke entlangklettern, selbst wenn diese eigentlich keine Griffmöglichkeiten bietet. Seine Geschwindigkeit entspricht dabei der normalen Klettergeschwindigkeit (GRW S. 224). Wenn er allerdings durch einen Angriff zurückgestoßen oder umgeworfen wird, verliert auch er den Halt.

Höchste Stufe: einmalig
SPACE1889.TalentDescWetterprophet:
Voraussetzung: keine

Der Charakter hat ein besonderes Gefühl für das aufziehende Wetter. Möglicherweise kann er es durch genaues Studium der meteorologischen Bedingungen vorhersagen, möglicherweise durch reinen Instinkt, vielleicht aber auch durch charakteristischen Schmerz in den Gelenken. Auf jeden Fall lässt er sich selbst von den eigenartigsten Wetterumschwüngen kaum überraschen.

Regeln: Der Charakter weiß an jedem Tag, welches Wetter bevorsteht, ohne dafür eine Überleben-Probe ablegen zu müssen. Er kann Regen ebenso vorhersagen wie Sonnenschein oder Schneefall und selbst Wirbelstürme, auch wenn die Angaben nie allzu exakt sind. So weiß er zum Beispiel nicht genau, wann der Regen beginnen wird und wie viele Liter pro Quadratmeter fallen, aber er kann sagen, ob er bald oder später beginnt und ob er stark und eher mäßig sein wird.

Höchste Stufe: einmalig
SPACE1889.TalentDescWillensstark:
Prerequisites: None

Your character is exceptionally courageous and driven. Her resolve and determination far exceed that of the average person.

Benefit: Your character gains a +1 Willpower rating. This bonus affects her Willpower rolls and any Willpower-based Skills. It also factors into her Secondary Attributes and raises her maximum Willpower rating by one point.

Advanced: This Talent is Unique.
SPACE1889.TalentDescWirbeln:
Prerequisites: Dexterity 3

Your character can attack the same opponent twice in quick succession, doubling the amount of damage he inflicts on enemies in close combat.

Benefit: Normally, your character can attack the same opponent twice by making a Total Attack with a –4 penalty on each attack roll (see Total Attack, p. 207). If your character possesses the Flurry Talent, he can attack the same opponent twice by making a Total Attack with a –2 penalty on each attack roll. Both attacks must be made with the same weapon or with a weapon and an unarmed attack.

Advanced: You can buy this Talent two times, allowing your character to attack the same opponent twice without penalty.
SPACE1889.TalentDescWissenschaftlicheImp:
Voraussetzung: passende Naturwissenschaft 4

Ihr Charakter kann sich bei der Entwicklung und Herstellung von Erfindungen den örtlichen Begebenheiten hervorragend passen. Er hat gelernt, aus geringen Mitteln das Beste zu machen und auch in einem Feldlabor oder improvisierten Werkstatt beeindruckende Ergebnisse zu erzielen.

Regeln: Beim Kauf des Talents muss eine Naturwissenschaft festgelegt werden, für die das Talent gilt. Die für eine Erfindung notwendige Stufe der Zuflucht-Ressource (Labor) (S. 83) ist um eins gesenkt. Wird die optionale Regel zu Komponenten verwendet, ist zudem eine Komponente weniger nötig, da ein alltäglicher oder leicht zu beschaffender Ersatz genutzt werden kann.

Höchste Stufe: 2. Die zweite Stufe senkt die benötigte Laborausstattung auf die Wirkungsstufe –2 und erlaubt die Ersetzung einer weiteren Zutat. Das Talent kann für mehrere Naturwissenschaften erworben werden.

Anmerkung: Dieses Talent ersetzt das Talent Feldchemiker aus Die Venus.
SPACE1889.TalentDescWuchtigerSchlag:
Prerequisites: Brawl 4

Your character’s unarmed blows are extremely powerful; she can stagger an opponent or even knock him off his feet.

Benefit: Normally, your character’s unmodified damage is compared to her opponent’s Strength rating. If she inflicts more damage than her target’s Strength rating, her opponent is knocked back five feet per additional success. If she inflicts more damage than twice her opponent’s Strength rating, her opponent is knocked clean off his feet. If your character possesses the Staggering Blow Talent she gains a +1 damage bonus to knockback her opponent. No additional damage is done, but the bonus makes it possible for your character to stagger or knockdown her opponent.

Advanced: You can buy this Talent up to four times. Each level grants your character an additional +1 damage bonus to knockback your opponent.
SPACE1889.TalentDescWuergegriff:
Voraussetzung: Waffenlos 4

Der Charakter ist Experte im waffenlosen Kampf und kann einen Gegner nur durch Schläge und Tritte in seiner Position festnageln, sodass dieser seinen Angriffen nicht entgehen kann.

Regeln: Der Charakter kann einem Gegner durch das Manöver Festhalten Schaden zufügen (GRW S. 218). Führen Sie das Manöver nach normalen Regeln durch, abgesehen davon, dass der Charakter Schaden erzeugt, sobald er mehr Erfolge erzielt als der Angegriffene. Schafft er nicht mehr Erfolge, dann misslingt der Angriff. Außerdem erzeugen misslungene Versuche des Angegriffenen, sich aus der Position zu befreien, keinen Schaden bei ihm.

Höchste Stufe: 3. Pro zusätzlicher Stufe erhält der Charakter jeweils einen Waffenlos-Bonus von 2 Würfeln.
SPACE1889.TalentDescZaeherHund:
Prerequisites: None

Your character is hard to kill! He can continue fighting even after taking enough damage to kill an ordinary person.

Benefit: Your character does not fall unconscious, and automatically stabilizes, when reduced to negative Health. He can continue to act, but will suffer wound penalties on all actions equal to his current Health. In addition, his death threshold is increased to –7 Health.

Advanced: You can purchase this Talent up to three times. Each additional level increases your character’s death threshold by two points (up to –11 Health).
SPACE1889.TalentDescZerreissen:
Voraussetzung: Klauen oder Krallen

Der Charakter kann mit seinen Klauen die Abwehr seines Gegners zerreißen oder seine Krallen in Schwachstellen in seinem Schutz versenken.

Regeln: Der Charakter führt einen Berührungsangriff (GRW S. 223) mit seinen Krallen oder Klauen aus. Dafür legt er eine Waffenlos-Probe (einschließlich Waffenmodifikationen) gegen die Aktive Abwehr des Angegriffenen ab (einschließlich aller Rüstungsmodifikationen). Wenn er mehr Erfolge als der Gegner hat, erzeugt er einen Punkt tödlichen Schaden plus je einen weiteren Punkt für zwei Punkte Größe des Angreifers. Wenn die Angriffsprobe höchstens genauso viele Erfolge wie die Abwehr ergibt, ist der Angriff misslungen.

Höchste Stufe: 3. Für jede weitere Stufe erzeugt der Charakter einen zusätzlichen Punkt tödlichen Schaden.
SPACE1889.TalentDescZickzackfahrer:
Voraussetzung: Fahren oder Spezielle Fahrzeuge (irgendeines) 4

Ein Zickzackfahrer kann sein Fahrzeug dazu bringen, unvorhersehbare Richtungsänderungen und Ausweichbewegungen zu machen, sodass man es wesentlich schwerer treffen kann. Ob das Fahrzeug für das Ausweichmanöver geeignet ist, entscheidet die Spielleitung, es empfiehlt sich aber, dass es vor allem für schnelle (Tempo (Tem) 20+) und bewegliche (Manövrierfähigkeit (Man) 0+) Fahrzeuge gilt.

Regeln: Der Charakter kann für jede Stufe des Talents 2 zusätzliche Würfel zu seiner aktiven Abwehr addieren. Alle weiteren Abwehr-Modifikationen gelten auch für diesen neuen Wert.

Höchste Stufe: 3
SPACE1889.TalentDescZickzackreiten:
Voraussetzung: Reiten 4

Ein Zickzackreiter kann sein Reittier dazu bringen, unvorhersehbare Richtungsänderungen und Ausweichbewegungen zu machen, sodass man den Reiter wesentlich schwerer treffen kann. Dies gilt auch für geeignete Flugtiere, wie z.B. die Skrill der marsianischen Queln.

Regeln: Sobald der Charakter auf einem bereitwilligen Reittier (S. 74) sitzt, kann er für jede Stufe des Talents 2 zusätzliche Würfel zu seiner Aktiven Abwehr addieren. Alle weiteren Abwehr-Modifikationen gelten auch für diesen neuen Wert. Zickzackreiten kann nicht eingesetzt werden, wenn entweder Reiter oder Reittier keine Aktive Abwehr haben.

Höchste Stufe: 3
SPACE1889.TalentDescZirpprogrammierung:
Voraussetzung: Selenit

Durch sein selenitisches Erbe, in Verbindung mit bestimmter Ernährung oder übertragenem Wissen, kann der Charakter mit drobetischen Rechenmaschinen in Verbindung treten, sie bedienen und Informationen daraus ziehen. Zudem kann er Piktogramme mit drobetischen Arbeitsanweisungen in eine Programmierung umsetzen.

Regeln: In Verbindung mit drobetischen Rechenmaschinen-Schnittstellen hat der Charakter die Fertigkeits-Spezialisierungen Ermittlung/Rätsel +3, Linguistik/Codes +3 und Naturwissenschaft/Ingenieurswesen +3. Mit diesen kann er die Rechenmaschinen nach Maßgabe der Spielleitung steuern, Informationen filtern und Programmierungen durchführen.

Höchste Stufe: einmalig
SPACE1889.TalentDescZivilisiert:
Voraussetzung: die Schwäche Primitiv

Der Charakter ist mit der Kultur der Außenwelt vertraut und hat den Umgang mit moderner Technik erlernt – entweder weil er von jemandem erzogen wurde, der ihn darin unterrichtet hat, oder weil er es gezielt gelernt hat.

Regeln: Der Charakter erleidet nicht den üblichen Abzug von 2 Würfeln bei modernen oder technikbezogenen Fertigkeiten (Primitiv, GRW S. 188).

Höchste Stufe: 3. Pro zusätzlicher Stufe erhält der Charakter 2 Zusatzwürfel bei modernen und technikbezogenen Proben.

SPACE1889.ResourceDescAbstammung:
Status represents your character’s social status. This can result from success within a respected profession – for example, doctors, lawyers, and professors – being a member of a wealthy aristocratic family, or working for infamous organizations like the mafia or underworld. In any case, your character’s position grants him respect, and he can impress his fellow people and sometimes even make them do him a special favor. Any time that your character’s social status or reputation applies to a situation, you receive a bonus to any related social rolls. For every two levels of Status your character has, he can purchase a Bonus Resource related to his friends and relations. Buying this Resource more than once grants your character additional respect and social opportunities.
If your character is of low social status, for example from a working class family or even a member of a minority, such as gypsy or a disliked nationality (which will vary from country to country), he suffers a penalty on all social skills when interacting with people of another class or nationality.
SPACE1889.ResourceDescArtefakt:
Artifacts represent unique, powerful items or vehicles in your character’s possession. It can be something that she invented, inherited, or had entrusted to her for safekeeping. It could also be something that she found or ran off with! Your character might not even be aware of the full potential of the artifact.
Artifacts come in a variety of shapes, sizes, and uses. A simple Artifact might be a nutrition substitute, a pill that makes food intake no longer necessary for the person taking it. A more advanced Artifact might be a handy astrogation calculator making navigation in space easier, or a heat ray which can be used as a weapon. Submarines fitted for deep sea explorations or a relic of ancient Martian technology represent some of the largest and most powerful Artifacts of all.
The more times you purchase this Resource, the bigger and more powerful the Artifact becomes or you might get another simple artifact. Of course, the usefulness of an artifact can vary between campaigns. For example, a gill mask might be of little use when travelling through the ether, but so is a rocket powered backpack on Venus. The final decision should therefore always be with the Gamemaster.
SPACE1889.ResourceDescBeziehungen:
Contacts represent your character’s network of acquaintances and associates. They are not particularly loyal to him and will only help if it is worth their while or clearly in their best interest. Nonetheless, having a network of contacts enables your character to call on them to find out information or useful items. Taking this Resource gives your character contacts in a particular sphere of influence such as academia, the criminal underworld, or the police. Any time that your character seeks equipment or information from someone within his area of interest, you receive a bonus on a related Skill roll. For every two levels you can also purchase one Bonus resource.
Buying this Resource more than once gives your character a new sphere of influence or increases his pull with his current contacts.
SPACE1889.ResourceDescGefolge:
Followers represent your character’s faithful friends, retainers, and animal companions. Followers are not always very skilled or influential, but they are fiercely loyal and will accompany your character wherever he goes. Followers are tremendously helpful and will take care of everyday tasks, but your character is responsible for paying their expenses while they are working for him.
Followers start out loyal to your character, making them easier for you to influence and harder for your enemies to sway (see Influence, p. 147). While you get to define the nature of your character’s relationship with his Followers, the Gamemaster ultimately controls these NPCs, and determines what they will or will not do. Abusing or taking advantage of Followers will negatively affect their attitude toward your character. Buying this Resource more than once either increases the number of Followers your character has, or improves their experience level. You can gain two inexperienced Followers, one skilled Follower, or improve two Followers each time you purchase this Resource.
SPACE1889.ResourceDescGoenner:
A Mentor represents your character’s patron, teacher, or protector. He is often a powerful and influential person who is connected to your character in some important way. He might be a blood relative, a senior member of the same organization, or a mysterious stranger who shows up to provide much-needed information. Although there is a lot that a Mentor can do for your character, loyalty is not a given; your character will occasionally have to complete tasks to stay in his good graces.
A Mentor acts in the background and considers it the character’s job to face the dangers and hazards of the outside world so that he does not have to. A Mentor’s help might still be of great use, as he can offer education, training, or financial support. He does not even have to be present to do so. He can forward information to your character by mail, telegram, through a riddle, or even a dream or a flashback.
A Mentor can provide Bonus dice to certain Skill rolls (to do so, a Mentor must possess the related Skill on level 4+, see Teamwork p. 151), provided that your character is able to refer to the Mentor’s help in a given situation.
Furthermore, for every two levels purchased, a character can borrow a Talent or a Resource from his Mentor. However, he simply cannot choose any Talent or Resource as he is limited to that that his Mentor possesses.
A Mentor will help your character, but his reasons for doing so may be a complete mystery. While you get to define the nature of your character’s relationship with her Mentor, the Gamemaster ultimately controls this NPC and decides exactly what he wants and what he is willing to do for you. Harassing your Mentor or taking him for granted will negatively affect his attitude toward your character, and then he might let your character down when he most needs him.
SPACE1889.ResourceDescRang:
Rank represents your character’s military rank or membership in an exclusive (or secret) organization, for example the Army, the National Geographic Society, or the Catholic Church. Your character has more authority when dealing with other members of his organization, and may be eligible to receive aid or resources. He might even be able to give orders to junior members of the same organization, just as he has to obey the orders of those above him.
Holding a position of authority grants your character respect even from those outside his organization. You receive a bonus on social Skill rolls anytime your character wields his authority or acts in the name of his organization. Official members of an organization can also requisition other Resources. For each two levels of Rank your character has, he can either temporarily acquire another Resource or boost one he already has (subject to Gamemaster approval). This temporary boost lasts until the requisitioned Resources are returned to the organization, at which point new Resources may be requisitioned.
While a high rank comes with many a privilege, abusing his authority, squandering resources, or breaking rules might result in your character being demoted or discharged from his organization.
Buying this Resource more than once gives your character more power, influence, and a higher rank in his organization, or grants him the membership in another organization.
SPACE1889.ResourceDescRuhm:
Fame is a measure of your character’s reputation and notoriety. It also represents how well known her name and face is. Being recognized as a celebrity has its benefits: people will often do special favors for your character just because she’s famous. On the other hand, being famous can have its downside—it is hard to keep a low profile when your profile is easily recognizable.
Your character may be an actress, daredevil, or criminal. When someone recognizes your character, you receive a bonus to all social rolls related to that person. For every two levels purchased in Fame you can also get a Bonus Resource from one of your admirers.
Buying this Resource more than once increases your character’s fame and reputation.
Your character can also have Negative Fame, representing his infamy and bad reputation, for example a deserter, rookie, or a wanted criminal. Characters with negative fame suffer penalties on related Skill rolls, and if recognized, can get into serious trouble.Fame is a measure of your character’s reputation and notoriety. It also represents how well known her name and face is. Being recognized as a celebrity has its benefits: people will often do special favors for your character just because she’s famous. On the other hand, being famous can have its downside—it is hard to keep a low profile when your profile is easily recognizable.
Your character may be an actress, daredevil, or criminal. When someone recognizes your character, you receive a bonus to all social rolls related to that person. For every two levels purchased in Fame you can also get a Bonus Resource from one of your admirers.
Buying this Resource more than once increases your character’s fame and reputation.
Your character can also have Negative Fame, representing his infamy and bad reputation, for example a deserter, rookie, or a wanted criminal. Characters with negative fame suffer penalties on related Skill rolls, and if recognized, can get into serious trouble.
SPACE1889.ResourceDescTiergefaehrte:
Similar to human entourage, animal companions are loyal servants and friends. They are not ordinary livestock or any pets or mounts, but unique animals that are particularly motivated to assist their masters in specific tasks and to accompany them on their travels.
The animal's motive can be gratitude, dependency or even loving devotion. Most animal companions have been painstakingly prepared for their task, perhaps even raised by their master. Almost all are dependent on their masters and need to be fed regularly. Some accompany their masters at all times - if small enough, they may reside in a pocket or even a fold of clothing. Others come and go as they please, but never stray so far that they lose track of their Master.
Not every animal companion has special abilities, but each is boundlessly loyal and will defend their master's life with their own. It is up to the player to determine exactly how the character and animal companions relate. But it is the GM who controls the familiar and decides what the animal does and doesn't do. For example, even a well-behaved Pacyosaurus may not understand that it is not allowed in Cologne Cathedral, and a monkey trained to steal small objects has no idea that it is inappropriate to close the amulet of a Highland Martian chief mops. Abuse or neglect of an animal companion generally creates problems in the relationship between it and its master, and in the worst case, can lead to its abandoning him when it is most needed.
There are no restrictions on which creatures can become animal companions, but the larger, wilder specimens are obviously harder to tame. Purchasing additional levels in this resource can either increase the number of animal companions or expand the abilities of the existing animal. All of the creatures described so far have an animal companion level, and this value reflects the corresponding level of the resource. If you want to create your own animals, use the following table or the detailed rules from EE p. 70ff.
SPACE1889.ResourceDescVerbuendeter:
Allies represent friends and family that your character can always count on. They have their own lives though, so their assistance only be counted on up to a point. Still, they are more than happy to do favors for your character or back him up when he needs help. Allies often have useful skill as well as Talents and Resources of their own. The more times you purchase this Resource, the more numerous and powerful your character’s Allies become.
Allies start out loyal to your character, making them easier for you to influence and harder for your enemies to sway (see Influence, p. 147). While you get to define the nature of your character’s relationship with his Allies, the Gamemaster ultimately controls these NPCs, and determines what they will or will not do. Abusing or taking advantage of your Allies will negatively affect their attitude toward your character, and if it comes to worst, they will even refuse to help your character when he most needs him. Getting back into their good graces may take an adventure or two!
Purchasing additional levels of this Resource gets your character a new Ally, or improves an existing Ally.
SPACE1889.ResourceDescVermoegen:
Wealth represents your character’s income and assets. It covers the amount of cash she has on hand and money she has to invest. Wealth does not automatically accord a character respect or authority, but a rich character can buy almost anything that she wants.
Your character starts play with her monthly income in cash. Wealthy characters can invest their money in other Resources. For each two levels of Wealth your character has, she can lose one level to temporarily acquire another Resource – for herself or for another character (subject to Gamemaster approval). The boosted character becomes more influential or able to build a bigger and better Artifact. This temporary boost lasts until that wealth is invested in another area, for example to buy another Resource.
Buying this Resource more than once grants your character additional income.
Negative wealth means that your character has low income or is even destitute.
SPACE1889.ResourceDescZuflucht:
Refuge represents your character’s home, private retreat, or secret laboratory. She either owns it free and clear or shares it with other members of her organization. Whatever the circumstances, this is a place where she feels safe and productive. When taking a Refuge you can choose one of the following specialties (determine when you buy this Resource):
Equipment: Special equipment grants each character within the Refuge a Bonus for a particular Skill (determine when you choose this specialty).
Size: With greater size a refuge either is more spacious on the inside or comes with a very large estate. Without this extra, the refuge is the size of a small apartment or a large workshop.
Security: If your refuge is well protected, every character trying to intrude or spy on it will suffer a penalty on his Skill rolls.
For each two level of Refuge your character has, your character can also purchase a Bonus Resource related to his refuge. For example, he could get a butler to join him on his travels, or an artifact in accordance to his workshop’s trade.
Taking this Resource more than once increases your character’s refuge, or gives him another one. With the Gamemaster’s approval, characters can pool their Resources together into a larger and more impressive Refuge. In this case, each character has limited ownership and access to the location.
A Negative Resource means that your character lives in modest surroundings or is even homeless. A poor home is ill-secured, giving intruders a Bonus on their Skill rolls when trying to break in.

SPACE1889.ResourceInfoBeziehungen: Network of associates that can be called on for items and information.
SPACE1889.ResourceInfoGefolge: Faithful friends and retainers that accompany your character.
SPACE1889.ResourceInfoGoenner: A powerful patron, teacher, or protector who looks out for your character.
SPACE1889.ResourceInfoRang: Rank and membership in a secret or exclusive organization,
SPACE1889.ResourceInfoRuhm: Reputation, notoriety, and influence due to your character’s popularity and exploits. (Basic Resource)
SPACE1889.ResourceInfoTiergefaehrte: An animal that is loyal to the character and supports him within his means.
SPACE1889.ResourceInfoVerbuendeter: Close friends and relatives that can be counted on for help.
SPACE1889.ResourceInfoVermoegen: Income and assets, plus amount of money available to invest. (Basic Resource)
SPACE1889.ResourceInfoZuflucht: A safe and comfortable home, private retreat, or secret laboratory. (Basic Resource)
SPACE1889.ItemKofferMitScriptenUndBriefe: Suitcase with scripts and letters from admirers
SPACE1889.ItemUniformMitOrdensbaendern: Uniform with ribbons and campaign pins
SPACE1889.ItemGutschriftEinerAnzahlung: Credit of a deposit for a country inn
SPACE1889.ItemDescArzttasche: A doctor’s bag contains all the important supplies for treating wounds. This includes scalpels, bandages, disinfectant, a pint of ether, gauze and other medical supplies. This grants a +1 bonus on Medicine rolls, and is good for ten uses.
SPACE1889.ItemDescChirurgenset: A Surgeon’s kit contains everything necessary to perform emergency surgeries in the field. This includes scalpels, forceps, bandages, disinfectant, a pint of ether, gauze, and other specialized medical equipment. This grants a +2 bonus on all Medicine rolls, and is good for ten uses.
SPACE1889.ItemDescEinbruchswerkzeug: This kit contains specially shaped tools, tongs, tweezers, skeleton keys, and other implements needed to open locks. The toolkit provides a +2 bonus for Larceny (Lockpicking) rolls.
SPACE1889.ItemDescSchminkset: A portable box containing make-up, fake noses, moustaches, mastic, and other materials necessary to create an effective disguise. This kit provides a +2 bonus on Disguise rolls, and is good for five uses.
SPACE1889.ItemDescBolzenschneider: Bolt cutters grant a +2 bonus to Strength rolls when cutting through metal, such as door locks.
SPACE1889.ItemDescBrecheisen: A crowbar grants a +2 bonus to Strength rolls when breaking open chests, prying walls apart, or performing other feats of brute strength. It can also be used as a club.
SPACE1889.ItemDescFotolabor: Includes worktable, chemicals, and electric light
SPACE1889.ItemDescMetallsaege: A small saw used to cut through metal. A character can cut through one inch of metal every ten minutes.
SPACE1889.ItemDescSchaufel: An essential tool for explorers performing excavations and archaeological tasks. If used as a weapon, treat as a two-handed club. If your character wishes to do lethal damage (by striking with the edge of the blade), you suffer a – 2 penalty on your Attack roll.
SPACE1889.ItemDescRuehmkorfflampe: The ‘Rühmkorff-apparatus’ consists of an electrical gas discharge lamp, which is served by a special accumulator with crank-elicitor. Rühmkorff-lamps are large and bulky, but robust. Experienced miners claim that a Rühmkorff-lamp is so reliable that one could possibly dig through to the center of the Earth without the lamp failing. The ingenious combination of accumulator and crank-elicitor ensures that the lamp literally never runs out of energy. The battery can be recharged anytime by simply turning the crank.
SPACE1889.ItemDescSumpfschuhe: These shoes, most frequently used on Venus, resemble snow shoes from Earth. They consist of a round woven wicker-frame, over which a net of plant-fibers is stretched. Attached to the feet they enable the wearer to walk on muddy ground without sinking in on every other step. Walking in swamp shoes needs practice, but it can be learned over one or two days. Wearing swamp shoes you move 25% slower, and both running and jumping are impossible.
SPACE1889.ArmorDescBrustpanzerMarsianisc: Especially popular with officers of Canal Martian guards, these breastplates expose the abdomen and decorate the chest. Made of hardened leather or rarer metal and with ornate shoulder plates, they show off strength and rank. To Martians and in situations where rank and courage are important, this can mean +1 dice on Diplomacy or Intimidate rolls.
SPACE1889.ArmorDescOenotrischeSchildinfa: This armor, composed of lamellar metal plates, is the pride of the Oenotrian infantrymen. Together with their shield rifle, they were considered invincible with it until the arrival of the humans. The armor is somewhat lighter than a complete plate armor, but still not insignificant in its disability.
SPACE1889.ArmorDescRotesSandtiegerfell:
Artifact 1

The fur of the red sand tiger is not only a protective and decorative trophy, it also retains its effect when properly treated by hill Martians who know the secret of tanning. For the wearer, this means +1 die to all Stealth rolls in the desert and steppe regions of Mars.
SPACE1889.ArmorDescSpinnentuchruestung:
Artifact 1

The fibers of this armor were made from the silk of domesticated Martian spider dogs and are much stronger than any earthly fabric. They are strong enough to stop bullets, shrapnel, or sword slashes. Almost all spidercloth has long since crumbled to dust and fragments, but a few suits have been stored in specially sealed rooms or crates for later use. They are as sturdy and flexible as when they were made, and extraordinarily useful. The secret of domesticating spider dogs and how to get them to produce silk was forgotten more than 20,000 years ago, but records of it exist in a few ancient Martian ruins. Spider dogs have become rare, but they still exist in wild areas along some dead canals near the equator. Those who discover the secret of how to harvest their silk and catch a few dozen of the animals could make new spidercloth armor.

SPACE1889.UnLockIdInfo:
Allows editing the SPACE1889 id.
The Id is used for internal identification, as well as for name generation in the actor item lists (the translation mechanism is based on this). If you create new items by duplicating existing ones that originally came from the compendium, this id should be changed as well, otherwise the item will still be displayed with the original name in the character sheet.
SPACE1889.LockIdInfo:
Blocks editing of the SPACE1889 id.
The Id is used for internal identification, as well as for name generation in the actor item lists (the translation mechanism is based on this). If you create new items by duplicating existing ones that originally came from the compendium, this id should be changed as well, otherwise the item will still be displayed with the original name in the character sheet.

SPACE1889.TourScSheetStep0: The character sheet contains all the information and data that make up a character. As usual in Foundry VTT, skills, specializations, talents, weaknesses, languages, resources, items, weapons, armor and money can be added by dragging and dropping from the corresponding compendiums.
SPACE1889.TourScSheetStep1:
The character image, the current and maximum health, the style points, the current and the used experience points are always displayed, no matter which tab is selected.

The maximum health is automatically calculated from the primary attributes, the size and, if applicable, the existing talents. Unlike other systems, such as D&D, the current health cannot be changed directly in SPACE 1899, but is calculated from the maximum health and injuries sustained. The dialog for adding damage is opened by left-clicking on the current health. The style points and the current experience points can be increased by left-clicking and decreased by right-clicking. By holding [Ctrl] and/or [Shift] the value of the increase can be increased from 1 to 5, 10 or 100.
SPACE1889.TourScSheetStep2:
In the Attributes tab you can set the general properties of the character, especially the Primary and Secondary Attributes are listed here. While the latter are calculated completely, the base value of the primary attributes can be changed by left- and right-clicking.

Left-clicking on the attribute name triggers a dice roll. This can be influenced by pressing additional keys.

  • click: normal roll, i.e. for primary attributes with double value
  • [Ctrl] + click: opens a dialog where the roll can be modified
  • [Ctrl] + [Shift] + click: also opens a modification dialog, but for primary attributes the normal dice count is now the plain value
  • [Alt] + click: Displays the attribute's description in the message chat (whispered to itself)
  • [Alt] + [Ctrl] + click: Displays the attribute's description in the message chat (public).
SPACE1889.TourScSheetStep3:
In the skills tab, all skills and specializations are displayed, with the specializations being sorted in with the associated skills. Of the listed values, only the level can be changed via left and right clicks, all other values are calculated automatically.

A click on the name transports the description in the message chat (whispered, with [Ctrl] public)

A click on the dice icon triggers the roll, with additionally pressed [Ctrl] opens a modification dialog for the roll.
SPACE1889.TourScSheetStep4: In the talents tab, the resources are listed next to the talents, whereby the four basic resources were already automatically added when the character was created at level 0. The operation is the same as with the skills, but there are only very few talents that require a separate probe roll and only for these the dice icon is visible (e.g. Assassin).
SPACE1889.TourScSheetStep5:
The Items tab lists all of the character's items (excluding weapons and armor). In addition to the number, the location of the item can also be changed. It can either be worn on the body, be in the backpack, or be in storage.
The weight sum of the three places (including weapons and armor) is indicated directly above this list and also which load level this corresponds to and its consequences.

The four load levels located at the top (by clicking on the name, the associated information can be transported into the message chat) are automatically calculated in terms of their maximum values.
SPACE1889.TourScSheetStep6:
In the weapons tab are listed to the weapons also the injuries, whereby with the latter also the healing factor (which is determined as known over a medicine roll) can be changed, whereby the healing duration is affected.

The weapons function as usual, thus info over click on the name and the roll over click on the dice icon. In addition, the four defense options are also listed, which trigger the roll via a click and send the definition to the message chat via [Alt] click.
SPACE1889.TourScSheetStep7: The last tab (Bio) contains the general information about the character and also the list about the cash assets including their equivalent in British currency. It is recommended to use the currencies from the Earth Money and Mars Money compendiums, as the currencies contained there already contain the appropriate exchange rates.
SPACE1889.TourPcNoCharacter: Create a player character to perform the tour
SPACE1889.FoundryBug8180:
Stop and pay attention! 


You have just migrated this Foundry 9 world to Foundry 10.285. In the process, all tokens not linked to the actor that differ in their items from the original actor (damage is also an item) have unfortunately been irreparably damaged by resetting all item values to their default value. See bug https://github.com/foundryvtt/foundryvtt/issues/8180

 

You have two options to avoid the migration bug:

  1. Switch back to Foundry 9.280, restore the backup and wait for the next Foundry release where bug 8180 will be fixed.
    1. Install Foundry version 10.284 and restore the backup
    2. Migrate all Space worlds from V9 to 10.284 (the Space 1889 system will automatically touch the tokens to avoid the bug-related data loss when updating to 10.285 later)
    3. Install Foundry version 10.285 and migrate the worlds from 10.284 to 10.285
    4. Have fun with Foundry 10
SPACE1889.VersionInfo:
SPACE 1889 - Version 1.0.3 - Martian Modernity

Martian Modernity v1.0.3

  • When adding damage, the resulting effects are not only displayed in chat, but also assigned to the token as an effect. This affects Stunned,Unconscious, Prone, and Death.
  • Extension of the Space 1889 Help Journal in the Compendium
  • Space 1889 help journal can also be opened in chat via "/help"
  • bugfix: Specializations for own skills can not be created (#12)

 

Martian Modernity v1.0.2

  • first system tour available: the character sheet
  • new journal entry compendium: Space 1889 help
  • passive-, active- and full defense is now directly accessible in the SC or NPC sheet
  • bugfix: characters can no longer be assigned to a vehicle crew position (#10)
  • bugfix: passive defense of vehicles cannot be changed (#11)

 

Martian Modernity v1.0.1

  • Fix Migration Workaround (Upgrade 9.280 => 10.284) 


Martian Modernity 

  • Switch to Foundry VTT version 10
  • Vehicles are supported by Token Action HUD
  • active and passive defense can be triggered directly by Token Action HUD
  • bugfix: vehicle defense can no longer drop below passive defense value (happened in 0.8.0 with large negative values for maneuverability

 

 

The crystalline Revolution 0.8.0

  • new actor type: vehicle
  • new vehicle character sheet
  • PCs and NPCs can be assigned positions in vehicles (by drag & drop from actor list)
  • automatic calculation also considering assigned PCs/NPCs
  • Maneuver dialog including available support
  • Vehicle compendiums (ether, land, air and water)
  • Vehicle weapons compendium
  • Bugfixes
